Reviews.Title: “Almost a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler (for pleasure) to San Francisco, and have stayed in many hotels there. This was one of the quietest rooms I've ever stayed in. It's hard to believe the hustle and bustle of a big city is right outside your room. The hotel is also small, so there was never a long wait for front desk service, or for elevators. It was a very short walk, with no hills, from the BART station, and close to almost everything we wanted to see and do. Don't bother with a car in San Francisco!! It is a terrific city for walking, and take busses, Muni, and cabs when you need to. We love Cafe de la Presse, across the street, for a very "Parisian" feeling breakfast, and Starbucks is right there too. Chinatown starts next door, and Union Square is a five minute walk away. Of course, we liked the "Green" aspect of the hotel too. Since I was traveling alone with my teenage son, it was quite a bonus to be able to go downstairs for a glass of Napa's finest, for a little adult break, while still in the same hotel. This would probably not be available in other hotels of this size. We did encounter a few problems with viewing pay per view movies and playing the free DVDs available, but my son was won over by the free treat that came along with the service, and they did try to remedy the problem. Also note that many hotels in this area (of the same star rating) are slightly cheaper, but are typically older, with thinner walls and no central air, so you have to open up a window to the noise of the city. Some of them are on very busy, congested streets, or have difficulty keeping the less charming aspects of the city (homeless, beggars) away from their front doors. We were able to walk in the area well past dark and feel very secure. So, for these reasons, I would say this was almost a four-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Eco-friendly Hotel. Great Location. Nice Staff.”
Reviews.Author: JanaFree
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a beautiful hotel set in one of the most convenient San Francisco locations. I was able to walk everywhere; the the Ferry Building on the Embarcadero, the BART, Union Square, the Mission, and even Fisherman's Wharf and the Marina. Comfortable guestrooms. Loved the fact that all lights, air, etc. is powered off when I leave the room. So "green." Had a nice view of outside from my room. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Extremely pleasant experience. I would stay here again for sure. I would like to see more vegan items on their menu, but their restaurant does include almost all local and organic items, so that is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but the valet services blows”
Reviews.Author: Xenos1
Reviews.Content: Liked the whole experience except for the valet car service. It is horrible! It's been one half hour, and still no car in sight. The bumbling staff are completely indifferent about the matter. I would otherwise come back and rate this place highly. Don't bring a car. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “great front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: LondonFreespirit
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and helpful front desk -especially the manager who was really clued up on good restaurants . There were problems with WiFi access in our room but they did all they could do sort it out and offered compensation for the inconvenience. The hotel is in a great location for shops, sights, restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: slowjoejak
Reviews.Content: Only small glitch was the breakfast in hotel. Ordered egg which was warm not hotel. Going back there soon so will eat at cafe next door! Hotel quiet and clean. Staff extremely pleasant and helpful. wifi in room great

Reviews.Title: “Fun Vacation in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: terryanne9
Reviews.Content: I holidayed here from Sydney, for 5 nites in February with my adult son. Great hotel with friendly staff-very quiet-did not hear another door shut during the stay & I'm a light sleeper. Clean, spacious rooms & very comfy bedding. Quick easy walk to Chinatown & easy downhill to Union Square: shops, restaurants & BART. Steep two blocks uphill back but suggest cable car ticket for 2-3 day stay & can hop off at corner, a few steps away. Thoroughly enjoyed the accommodation & would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Jane H
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed here and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The location was fantastic just off Union Square and near the financial District. The staff were so friendly and made us feel so welcome,no request was too much trouble. I would definitely go back here the next time i go to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Austind88
Reviews.Content: Had a short break in San Francisco in early March. Hotel was in good condition, very clean, very comfy beds. Location was great, steps from Union Square and Chinatown. Valet parking was reasonable and convenient. We had breakfast across the road in an amazing French cafe, very good breakfasts. I recommend this hotel for business, couples and friends. Thank you for a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights first time sightseers to San Francisco and found hotel to be great location, well appointed but very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A shabby place”
Reviews.Author: walton_rebecca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. It is a shabby hotel. The staff seem unsure of themselves and harrassed. My room key did not work on a couple of occasions and had to be reprogrammed. The rooms are quite spacious but far from clean. The bath plug did not fit. The breakfast room is not really set up to deliver a good breakfast fast although the breakfast that finally came was the best bit of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely clean and friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: RaineeDavo
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in San Francisco recently after 4 weeks travelling. This was the best ( and not nearly the most expensive). Spotlessly clean, comfy bed, nice room and walking distance to all the attractions and public transport you could want. Would recommend the Boulangere for breakfast nearby an Da Flora in little Italy was an excellent restaurant. For a day trip, cycling the golden gate bridge and having a nice lunch by the waterfront in Sausalito was great. Hired a car to see the ancient redwood forest at Muir Woods was amazing, only a short drive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Bowie09Sydney
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for a family of four in December. The location is so convenient - restaurants and shopping at your doorstep; easy walk to North Beach, Union Square. The rooms were very comfortable and tastefully albeit simply furnished. The staff were most obliging. Free internet was a nice change after some of the other places we stayed. We would highly recommend this hotel for its great location and clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcjools
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel for 6 nights in March 2011 on a work trip. This is a great hotel for business travellers. Neat, comfortable rooms with all the mod cons. Lovely bathroom. Nice comfy sofa and coffee table. The bed was super comfortable and the rooms were well sound proofed. I had a great nights sleep every night. I ate breakfast each day in the restaurant. I can recommend it. I even tried the HUGE breakfast burrito a couple of times. It beat me at first, but by the end of my stay I was able to manage the whole lot (what a skill!). I also ate dinner in the restaurant a couple of times - the service was great, though this might be because I was the only one in there (I think I must eat dinner a lot earlier than other people!). I loved the fact that this is an eco-hotel and, in particular, the separate recycle bins in the room. The hotel is in a great location. I was able to walk to the office building I was visiting. I also walked to the shopping area (there's a fantastic Macy's - and I can highly recommend the dinner at the Cheesecake Factory). I also snuck in a trip to Alcatraz, and the ferry was only a short taxi ride away. I can't think of a bad thing to say about this hotel. It was ideal for my purposes, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bead109
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location, central for walking everywhere. The front desk staff were pleasant, although not terribly knowledgable and we had to ask for information regarding the hotel rather than being offered information about internet access, gym, etc. The rooms are not the biggest, but they are clean and decently appointed. The bathrooms are spacious. The bed is very comfortable with fluffy duvet and plenty of pillows. We've stayed here once before and would definitely stay at this hotel again. It's not fancy but it's clean, comfortable, and a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbgirl_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Sept 2011, and had a great experience. Rooms were lovely, people were nice and the location was great. Only issue was the horrendous car parking, but this is an issue everywhere in San Francisco! We had a hire car the first night as it was the end of our trip, and it took over an hour to get it from the parking garage once we requested it. It was a busy time, and we were probably a bit naive, but they should probably warn people that it will take a while. I assume an hour was way longer than normal as when they realised how long it actually took they waived the parking fee. I think the moral is to ditch the car in San Francisco! Would not hesitate to stay again or recommend it to friends though. And no street noise which seems a common problem!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lily N
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Orchard Garden very much; very good location for turists, walking distance from about everywhere, shoppings, cable car, buses and more. The rooms are fine, but I would choose the double instead the king room. Staff was very pleasant and helpfull, giving us an early check-in after a looooong trip, wich was great. The streets near Union Square are a little scary by night, but not the hotel street, a few steps from Chinatown gate. I also recomend Cafe de la Presse, right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: budinam
Reviews.Content: The orhcard is great. I had a double standard room and it was very spacious. I was there for 9 nights, and for 3 of them there was a couple in the next room that argued pretty loudly in the mornings. I guess this could happen in any hotel. The cable car has a stop right on Bush street and Powell, just steps away from the hotel entrance. There is a Starbucks store one block down the hill that might come handy if you just want a quick breakfast. Union Square is just two blocks down the hill, and if you pass it by and keep walking you get to the end of Powell street where the cable cars turn. All major stores are in this area, across the avenue, ther is a big mall, with movie theatres inside, in case you want to catch a movie as I did.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect San Francisco hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tifosa23
Reviews.Content: I chose the Orchard Garden Hotel because I needed a well-deserved getaway with luxurious, affordable comfort. I loved the perfect location, since I planned to spend much time in North Beach (10 minute walk) and Union Square (less than 10 minute walk), and of course Chinatown is right outside the door! The room was fabulously comfortable with the silkiest bed linens. The staff was lovely, always helpful, and very kind. While I didn't eat at the restaurant, I adored Pachino, an outstanding pizzeria right around the corner on Kearney Street. My entire 3-day experience was sublime, and I highly recommend this hotel for a fantastic San Francisco getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Fulfills your basic needs and more”
Reviews.Author: awong93
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at Orchard Garden Hotel with 8 others. When we first arrived at the hotel, we asked for directions to Union Square, Japantown, etc. An Asian woman was at the counter (I do not have her name) and she gave us maps after instructing us. We continued to see her every morning for the next two days. She was always very cheery and polite, willing to help. The staff there is generally commendable and we noticed that some of them take on multiple roles- the bell boy is also the waiter at the restaurant on the first floor, for example. The hotel is small but rather cosy. My sister and I were lucky to have a spacious room with an additional couch. We could hear people talking at night but thankfully, there were not too many people occupying the rooms on our floor and it wasn't too noisy. The beds were large and there was an iHome in each room. The food is average. We had eggs, turkey ham and toast every morning. I would have liked more variation in what was served. The gym is small with not much equipment, all of which were out of order during my stay. Yet, overall, I really enjoyed my stay at Orchard Garden Hotel, mostly because of the excellent service and the nicely-furnished rooms. Not having too many people in the same hotel also gave a sense of privacy. We had the whole restaurant to ourselves in the morning. There is wifi as well, as an additional plus point. The other hotels I went to in Las Vegas and L.A., Harrah's and Marriot The Courtyard, both pale in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Fresh, and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: elatho
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel whenever we go to San Francisco for the weekend. The rooms are a little small but very comfortable. You can always rely on the staff being friendly and helpful and the rooms being clean, fresh with very comfortable beds. It is located right outside the entrance to China town on Bush street, just a few blocks from Union Square. The price is a great value for the location and quality that you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Large beautiful room, excellent location, WONDERFUL staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesG316
Reviews.Content: Our first time to San Francisco, so we chose this hotel based on Internet information only. But it turned out to be a hit. It is close to everything. The room was larger than expected, very clean, very nicely designed. It was very quiet. The bed was very comfortable. And there was nice desk space to work. So, the room was beautiful. But the hit of this hotel was its front-desk staff and a tall smiling gentleman who literally walked into the middle of the street, down a block or so, just to hail a cab for us. It was raining, the traffic was light but steady, and right out there was this guy going all out for me and my kids, who he didn't know from Adam. My kids were amazed at how dedicated he was. And when we needed a driver during rush hour to take us to another city, right at cabbie-shift-change time - which makes finding a cabbie impossible - this guy dialed a reliable driver he knew and in minutes we had a private livery (limo) driver taking us to Oakland. Unbelievable. The female front desk staff was just the same. Very friendly, super helpful, never in your way but always there to help. My kids and I travel often - Chicago, DC, NYC - and I have never previously run into a consistently-wonderful front desk group. They were ALL nice, and all pleasant, but not in a smarmy, overbearing way. Just like...family welcoming you back, genuinely. Since the lobby is narrow, you must walk by them as you go to the elevator, so passing by them was always a nice warm welcome back. A stab in the dark for us in finding a hotel, but it was fantastic. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LEED certified, but not wifi friendly”
Reviews.Author: J20009
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the edge of Chinatown and close to Union Square. Good points: Nice, clean and quiet rooms. Comfortable bed. Nice linens. Bad points (from really bad to annoyance): TERRIBLE wifi (extremely slow, hard to connect to, disconnects very quickly) - worse aspect of the hotel; check out took more than 10 minutes; poor water pressure in the shower (probably because of LEED certification) very small closet; very small and cramped lobby (if there are more than 3 or 4 people checking in or out, the hallway to the elevators will be blocked); "fitness center" is a joke (two of the three machines were out of service); shower curtain rod was falling down

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladybird859
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet street just near the entrance to Chinatown, and a short walk to Union Square. As San Francisco is known for its undulating streets be sure to pack a comfortable pair of walking shoes. The room on the 9th flloor was clean and quiet, offered free Wi Fi and the use of a printer in the business centre, if needed. There were many restaurants within walking distance offering a wide variety of foods. The only down side was no laundry facilities other than a laundry service which would prove to be quire expensive. Other alternative was a self service laundry up the street which required $5 in quarters to operate. A short walk to the Powell St Trolley down to Fisherman's Wharf - very touristy, but a lot of fun. Start early and get a day pass, that way you can ride as many times in the day as you like. Staff at the front desk were helpful. Had a pleasant experience would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MgmvH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few blocks away from Union square, cable car and chinatown. Also a lot of dining options in the neighbourhood. The hotel has free wifi and the bathroom is large.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: TAmember123
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Orchard Garden for two nights and had a nice stay. I requested a quiet room and was given a top floor room at the back - very quiet. Nice, spacious room and bathroom. There was a distinctive slight patchouli smell but it either went away or I got used to it. My only complaint is that the doors slam so whenever someone goes into or out of their room, there is a loud banging in the hall. They don't include a breakfast in the rate so I took a walk to Lori's Diner (short, eight-minute walk) because the french cafe across the street doesn't open until 7:30 a.m. There's a Starbucks nearby (actually several) and a Posh Bagel. There is a small fitness room with a treadmill, bike and elliptical. Not much else, but it does the job. The location is good - easy to walk to Union Square. Valet parking was expensive, but comparable to other SF hotels I've stayed in. We were here on business and the hotel suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: PhotoMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in a superior king room. The location is excellent at the Gates to Chinatown and a couple of blocks from Union Square. There are lots of dining options nearby and a good french cafe opposite. Had breakfast in the hotel almost every morning - delicious and good value. Service from staff is OK or below average but most of the time we tend to call our own cabs and bags. The wifi is free but very slow. The room itself was quiet, spacious and clean. We were on the 10th floor overlooking into Chinatown (Grant Ave). Definitely would recommend this hotel purely due to location and good sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to China Town and Union Square - typical hotel decor”
Reviews.Author: Californiyeah
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with reasonably clean rooms. This is a LEED certified hotel for "green" buildings so be aware there will be low flow toilets/shower heads, sealed windows, etc. and a lack of that bleach clean smell with the towels. We found no problem with the "green" features and think the hotel does a good job blending with guest comfort. The parking is better at some other hotels in the city (valet $40) but you can't beat being this close to China Town and Union Square. The rooms were a little small but ok for our family of four. Better breakfasts can be found than the one in the hotel. We liked the AC in the room - can be hard to find in SF. The Hotel Triton is nearby and looked like a funky (less traditional decor) type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Green" and "Clean"”
Reviews.Author: amalfiOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: Modern, comfortable and the rooms are VERY clean which is a priority when I'm travelling. We had a lovely room facing the street and we could barely hear any traffic because of their double paned windows. The rooms are small but our family of four fit perfectly. It is close to everything including Chinatown, Union Square and Cable Car. It is about a half hour walk to the Fisherman's Wharf. My only complaint would be their double beds. It would have been nice had they had queen size beds. As far as comfort goes, their beds were very comfortable. We tried their on site restaurant for breakfast and were not impressed as they were out of certain things they offered on the menu plus it was way over-priced. There are two Starbucks across the street and plenty of places to eat. Try the Irish Bank for their delicious stew. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very nice, although customer service a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: iziver
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were both very comfortable. Room was spacious, bed was very comfortable, and the "green" attention was very nice. What detracted from the stay was that I left a pair of glasses behind and called the hotel within an hour or two of leaving. The glasses were found and I made arrangements with them that I would return in 3 days to pick them up. When I went back to the hotel, no one could locate the glasses. After calling a number of times the next day, the glasses were finally found and they did mail them to me, however I just realized that they charged me for the mailing, which strikes me as not providing a level of service that one would expect from this level of a hotel. Had I not gone back there to pick the glasses up, I could understand the charge. That they "lost" them and but for that error on their part had to mail them, it would seem to me that they should cover the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: permand
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. Very nice and modern rooms, friendly service and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, green-friendly”
Reviews.Author: akamai_gurl
Reviews.Content: This place was fun to stay. Very nice, and in good location for China town. Close to one of my favorite restaurants Cafe de la Presse. Customer service was superb, and they went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Rooms are very comfortable, as were the beds, and the bathroom was pleasant. They boast being a green hotel, environmentally friendly. Euro style lights, where you slip the card in at the door to activate the lights in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: alton1
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem in the heart of chinatown and union square. I would like to start off with the wonderful and personal service I recieved from Victoria...My situation was not the usual one..however Victoria made a difficult trip into a pleasant one..her compassion and thoughfullness will not be forgotten and greatly appreciated...Our room was clean, modern and very spacious...the bathroom was also very large and had all the ammenities one could expect from a boutique hotel. I was very pleased every single time I left the hotel and returned the staff always acknowledged my departure and arrival with my name and welcome back!! This is my new and only place I will stay when visiting S.F. Room service food was excellent and a good value for room service prices in S.F. I cant say enough good things about this hotel...it's one of only a few hotesl that I can say I really "feel at home". Thank you to all the staff for your excellent service. I look forward to my next stay. Visit thier website for pay now and save rates..it's fully pre-paid....however it's a excellent deal if your dates are solid. Don't waste your time with research...if your plans bring you to S.F. stay at this property you will be pleased with your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: FLYINNOW
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden is right around the corner from the entrance to Chinatown, so we found it very conveniently situated to get to all the attractions on our list for this visit. The reception was excellent upon arrival as well as when we left. It's a very modern hotel, eco-friendly and very comfortable and clean. There was no noise from the street to keep us awake-- very well -insulated. The restaurant staff were attentive and the breakfasts were yummy. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel thus far”
Reviews.Author: ann b
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a modest, modern decor but pleasantly well kept. the service is what escalated it to highest possible ranking. I have stayed in many hotels, but have never before experienced more perfect service. from the front desk, to the personal service staff, to the restaurant, everyone was so professional, kind, and pleasant. Being my synical self, i can usually find something to complain about, but this time...not possible. i wish i had ten thumbs so i could put them all up. just be careful about parking there..VERY expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: AnciaB
Reviews.Content: I would definitely come back to Orchard Garden Hotel. The staff was very polite, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the location is perfect! It was our first trip to SF and we felt as if everything was within the walking distance from the hotel. Chinatown is right next door, Union Square is right around the corner. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: asylum09
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed for one night at the orchard garden hotel while passing thru SF for our one year wedding anniversary. we were greeted at the front desk by ruby. although check in time is not until 3pm, they allowed us to have early check in and had a room available for us. upon noticing it was our anniversary ruby gave us two little boxes of chocolates. the room was clean. the shower worked well. the bed was comfortable. they provided soft robes for lounging around in. the tv had a cute personalized welcome message. the tv worked but some of the features did not (the HD.....not a big deal). I slept well and was not bothered by sounds of other guests, i would have thought we were the only ones on the floor. if i had one complaint, it would be the parking. there is none. they valet for about $45, which we did not use. instead we parked around the corner at the st. mary's garage for about $38 for the day/night. we did not eat at the restaurant during our stay. overall i would say we had an enjoyable stay and certainly would consider staying here again if we happen to be in the area. oh i should also mention, they have (or had at the time of our stay) a "first time guest" discount rate. have not ever seen/stayed at a hotel with this offer, so for us it is what helped make the decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the FiDi”
Reviews.Author: bruceww
Reviews.Content: I've been hoteling at the Orchard Garden since they opened sereral years ago and I can't believe I'm just now getting around to review it. Maybe it's because it's a bit of a secret and as more people discover it I tend to be a bit possessive. The staff is great, the rooms have a Euro feel, it was SF's first certified "green" hotel, and for business in the FiDi it's a welcome option. Restaurant Roots is great but being in the "French" sector there are lots of great food options, most notably Cafe de la Presse just across the street that never disappoints, especially for petit dejeuner.

Reviews.Title: “Sustainable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cui-Li
Reviews.Content: My husband was here on business, whilst I was here for pleasure. It was a very comfortable stay right in the heart of San Francisco. Easy walking distances to various places of interest, with no steep climb! A big plus here in SF! Enjoyed A feel good stay (environmentally-friendly) as this hotel do practice energy conservation, ie: energy-saving light bulbs, lights activated by inserting card key only, housekeeping really abiding by sign: ''re-using towels, bed-linen". Loved the smell of its cosy bedding. The room with its amenities is very pleasant, tastefully decorated, quiet and offered me a very good sound sleep! I like the spacious bathroom and room lightings (non-glaring).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: lonestarbt
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Orchard Garden Hotel and we were very impressed. It's a beautiful hotel in a central location with many amenities especially the very comfy bed. The room and bathroom were plenty big and really liked the key card energy control system. Very nice staff who make your visit all the better. Even after we left and my hubby realized he had left a shirt in the closet, we called and at this writing the shirt is in the mail to us. The location is excellent...steps from Chinatown and a few blocks from most of the attractions we wanted to see. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property in the heart of SF. After living here for a decade I have come to appreciate return visits that involve a hotel and this one certainly does not disappoint. It's super clean, has lots of eco-friendly features without skimping on creature comforts (particularly the plus, down-filled beds). Free wi-fi doesn't hurt. I was impressed by the facilities and would absolutely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but central location, adjacent to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: aitchbea
Reviews.Content: Great location handy for Chinatown, Union Square and within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf if the cable car was full ! Friendly, helpful staff on the desk, smart, clean rooms with plenty towels & other amenities. Nice roof terrace to enjoy last rays of the sun after a busy sightseeing day. Cafe de la Presse across the street great for breakfasts, evening meals but pricey but great food. would have no hesitation in booking the Orchard Garden again.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: chickensoup26
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was small but very cozy. The hotel is walking distance to Union Square and the gates of Chinatown is just next door. They have a fabulous French cafe across the street. The food was delicious. The cable car to the wharf was very easy. High five to the staff. Valet parking is $40.00 for guests which is pricey to me but is probably the total norm for downtown San Francisco. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. I got a great rate on one of the nights. My King bed was super comfortable and had a great nights of sleep. I felt very safe in the area of where the hotel was. The weekend I stayed was during fleet week which explained why all the other hotels were completely booked but I'm so glad that this was not sold out because it really was a very great hotel. Our room was super clean. I would definitely reserve here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BSMI
Reviews.Content: Nice size and clean rooms. All service was very friendly. Location was great: we were able to walk everywhere in the city. The only concern we had was the valet. We often had to leave our car on the street (even double parked) for a very long time before it was picked up. Also, they estimate about 15-25 minutes to bring you your car, but the first morning we waited about 50 minutes. After that, we figured out that the best thing to do was let the front desk know the night before what time we would like our car the next morning. It was always ready. Overall, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jasonx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden over the weekend during fleet week in San Francisco. The hotel isnâ€™t huge, about 10 stories with 10 or so rooms on each floor, but large enough to not to feel cramped which can happen with some boutique hotels. The location between Union Square and China Town is convenient and provided easy access to the cable car down to the Warf. The rooms are a bit on small side but well-appointed and comfortable. The 1st room we were given had a sliding bathroom door which didnâ€™t seem to close completely and didnâ€™t necessarily provide full privacy. The room was still fine for us but we were adjacent to a family with young, very upset, screaming children. After waiting it out it died down so we thought the worst was over. The next morning it continued again and we decided to change rooms and the hotel was very accommodating to this request. We were moved to a room on the top floor which we liked very much. This one was a corner room with a very large 5 piece bathroom. I imagine all rooms in this hotel have their own unique floor plan. The staff at the Orchard Garden is very friendly and helpful. Being in town for fleet week was a fluke on our end since this was just a loosely planned quick trip for us to get out of town. But it made the public transportation a nightmare. We planned to take busses, cable cars, etc., around town but the waits, especially from the Warf, were just too long to waste our time on. We waited for a muni bus for about 30 minutes only to have it wave to us as it passed by because it was too full by the time it got to our stop (happened twice). So to get around town we ended up using mainly town cars because they were easier to flag down and cabs were few and far between and always full. Not sure if itâ€™s always this bad, but it was our experience over this weekend. Up bush there is a small market to get some snacks if you donâ€™t feel like getting them from the mini bar. There is also another small market at Bush and Kearny. We ate brunch at CafÃ© de la Presse across the street one morning and it was very good. We ate at the hotel twice, once for breakfast and once for room service dinner. Both meals were good and I feel the food was better than average as far as hotel restaurants go. We ate in the Warf and in Union square, but nothing really worth mentioning. For our last meal we walked down about 1 Â½ blocks down bush on the left, and found several restaurants tucked into an alley. Canâ€™t remember the name of the one we chose, but the food was good. Also the Irish Bank bar across from the hotel was nice for a pint.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: melbla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent trip to America. It was a very comfortable, clean and spacious room with a really big bathroom too. It's in a good location with plenty of nice places for breakfast very close by. The only thing I would advise is if you're partial to a slight lie in (anything later than 8.30am), leave the Do Not Disturb sign on your door in the mornings as the housecleaning staff seem very keen! They knocked the door around 8.15am most mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean. Staff is on point. Location is nice. But like other review said bring some soap bar is smallest I've evere seen. taxes on valet are high but that's not there problem add almost 6 bucks to 40 dollar parking. Enjoyed my stay great value!!! Will be back

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Becky T
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel as it had good reviews but ended up a bit disappointed. I would have given 4 stars but when we returned home we found our credit card had been charged for mini bar items that we didn't have. Although we have been promised a refund I still found this an inconvenience and worrying that this would have been charged when we didn't get a bill for it when we checked out. Postives 1. Clean modern room 2. Friendly staff 3. Good location to attractions Negatives 1. Room was quite small 2. No wow factor, the lobby area was very small and dull. 3. Hotel not following their green policy. We hung up our towels as we didn't need them replacing but we still received new towels every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: MacGregor07
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over Fleet Week weekend and enjoyed the location. Close to Chinatown and bigtime shopping. The feel of the place is a little like Europe - small and accomodating. Joy was at the front desk for what seemed like the entire 48 hours and she is a great help. Nice value here.

Reviews.Title: “â€œBarely Greenâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Ani7
Reviews.Content: One of the best features of Orchard Garden is its central location near the Chinatown Gate. Easy walking distance to BART, Cable Cars, restaurants, and Union Square. At the same time, it is very quietâ€”very little noise from inside or outside the hotel. The room and bed were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and professional. Lobby is very small. Business center with 2 terminals and a printer was utilitarian; ask for a key card to get in. We felt that it was a good value, especially when booked in advance as part of a package on their website. We were not very impressed with the â€œgreenâ€� aspect of the hotel. Yes, itâ€™s good that you turn on and off the lights with your room key card, and like most hotels these days, you can request that your towels and bed linens not be washed daily. The heating/cooling system, however, left a lot to be desired for energy conservation: the AC was a little cool when we came into the room, so we adjusted the thermostat, and immediately the heat came on! We found that whenever you adjust the thermostat within just two degrees of the actual temp, either the heat or AC turned on. We were pleasantly surprised by the breakfast at Roots, the hotelâ€™s restaurant. The buffet was not very impressive, but the served breakfast was delicious with crunchy bacon, fresh fruits, and the best oatmeal that weâ€™ve had in ages. The egg dishes were perfectly done and the service was attentive if a little slow. The evening menu was limited; it might be handy if you came in late, jet-lagged and didnâ€™t want to venture out.

Reviews.Title: “Legendary service”
Reviews.Author: anyelangel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard garden. During oracle. The hotel is very clean the location is great. And the best quality that this hotel has is the staff. Thank you ms joy Zamar. You are the reason I will returned to this hotel. You went above and beyond. Legendary service thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: WuTang2027
Reviews.Content: It's not the swankiest hotel in San Francisco but it's in a good location and reasonably priced in the area (compared to other $400+/night). It's right down the street from Chinatown gate so you can easily grab some dim sum for brunch, close to cable car line that takes you to Fisherman Wharf, and close to Union Square shopping. Service was great- I arrived much earlier than normal check-in @ 11am; fortunately they had a room available to check in to which was much appreciated. Room was very clean and comfortable. We also received $10 free minibar which was a nice bonus. Overall a nice stay for our one night in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with nice location, but a bit $.”
Reviews.Author: PboroBill
Reviews.Content: Splurged a little and went with this hotel as we had two nights to stay in SFO. I was hoping to find somewhere with a reasonable parking surcharge in a nice part of town, but that apparently just isn't much of an option without a lot of pre-planning, and 4-6 weeks isn't enough to do that. Overall...nice place. Rooms are very small but adequate. Bathroom however, was very spacious. Found that a bid odd. They also had a green initiative, where the A/C and most electricity wouldn't run without you putting your room key in an slot right by the door. No more running the TV and AC while you go to dinner. Good for them. Not much to say, other than it was in a good location and was very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but some mess ups,along the way”
Reviews.Author: Londongeezer222
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of reviews on this site. Overall, the stay was excellent, but I need to point out these few things which did not go so well. I went with my mum and had booked a twin-bed room on the net, via their website. Somehow when we got there, they had managed to translate this into two separate double rooms, so this took about five minutes to sort out (not a good start). Then we had problems with the safe, maintenance guy was called up and he wasted over 30 mins trying to sort the safe out, despite us saying that we had decided not to use it (selective hearing obviously or just plain stupid). World's strangest coffee maker at Orchard Garden (comes with no off switch). You have to disconnect at mains to switch it off and the thing leaked everywhere (it was our second coffee maker and the maid who delivered it did not speak good english, so could not explain the workings of the machine properly). Hotel is indeed in a great location, with restaurants and public transport all close at hand. Staff at hotel and friendly and knowlegeable. Roots restaurant has very strange dishes on offer and also a very limited menu. Have breakfast there by all means, but for your evening meal, check out some of the local restaurants, however two you should definately avoid are Cafe Claude (appaling service and overpriced food) and the Irish Bank Bar and Restaurant (almost no concept of customer service there, so we walked out and went elsewhere). I had problems getting wi-fi connectivity, but seems it was linked to my lappy and not with their wi-fi provider, so I had to continually use the business centre to check emails and such. They only have two terminals in the business centre, so be sure to get there early, else you could be in for a very long wait. On the face of it, I'd probably stay elsewhere, if I was staying in the heart of San Fran, but it's probably one of the better ones, if you are looking four star and above. It's your choice really.

Reviews.Title: “Take some soap”
Reviews.Author: bassing-jersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in August, The hotel was in a great location and the staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the free wi fi was good. The only down side was one tiny bar of soap that would have run out washing me arms let alone the rest of me. My advice would be take your own soap, apart from that the hotel was good

Reviews.Title: “Nice green hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jessandshawn
Reviews.Content: I arrived in San francisco with a sinus infection. I called the hotel to find a local doctors office and they referred me to one who was 4 blks away from hotel. Btw great doctor. We used the Bart system and got off 1 stop 2 early on a one way street and walked 5 blks to doc office. So after doc apt. I called to make sure there would be a room available. She said to me they were sold out the night befor and she would do here best to have a room ready. Well we got there at 2:15 and we were informed that there wasn't a room ready and if we wanted to check in the room that was ready was a "superior king" & it would be 30$ more. I only paid for it cause I felt near death. Basically I felt ripped off when I opened the door to my "superior" room. I didn't have the energy or time to sit and wait for my regular room rate. If you get a good price book it just don't get suckered in to the upgrade. Also wifi never worked. But on the other hand it was a very clean room. Not much wow factor but comfortable. Staff was very helpful and nice, not counting my check inn. Great location and I even made it to our cruise to Alcatraz which was really cool. All in all it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good location, comfy”
Reviews.Author: researchingvacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights as part of a 10 day trip. The beds here were the most comfy of any of our trips. The sheets were so soft. The shower was just ok though, hot and cold was switched and it was kind of small. The room was a little crowded, but not bothersome in any way. You do have to pay $40 a night to park and give them 20 minutes to retrieve your car, but it only took 10 minutes the 2 times we used the valet. Great location. TRY the breakfast at the french place across the street, super yummy. Best french toast ever! No amenities in this hotel, but the san fran streets make you so tired that all you need is that super comfy bed anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ATLtraveler306
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Stayed for 2 nights with our 7 and 4 year old children. The room was spacious (by SF standards) and centrally located to trolley/bus/rail/shopping and dining. It was significantly cheaper than other nearby hotels. Very clean and safe. Staff was incredibly polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a great room to hang out in..”
Reviews.Author: canfindaname
Reviews.Content: The view from my room on the 3rd floor, side of the building was, literally, of a brick wall. There was no sunlight able to come in the room at any time of day. So if you are going to spend a lot of time working in your room, be sure to ask for one with more light!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: My only complaint......$40.00 a day parking. I would rather pay more in room than to have to pay seperate parking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: rydyl
Reviews.Content: We chose the Orchard Garden Hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and it's central location. I especially liked the comments about the hotel being quiet since we've encountered noisy hotels quite often in our travels. The hotel definitely met expectations for location, noise level (which was amazing considering the location in the city), and quality of hotel (very nice). We did not eat at the restaurant, so we can't comment on it's quality. The room was adequately sized for a family of four and the beds were comfortable. We had notified the hotel of a feather allergy and our need for feather free bedding at the time of reservation, as well as the day before arrival, but the room had down bedding when we checked in. The hotel did get the bedding changed out quickly and without inconvenience to us, but considering our multiple notifications of the need for down free bedding we expected the room to be ready at check-in. The doorman/concierge we had our first night was very helpful in making restaurant recommendations and the one we went to did not disappoint. Our only issue with this hotel was parking. Although the rate was very high (as with most SF hotels), we knew the rate in advance and had no issues with cost. Our problem was the length of time it took to get our car when we wanted to use it. The hotel parking is offsite and valet ONLY. This means you need to call the front desk to request your car. The timeline was always given as 15 minutes, so we could at least plan ahead to time our call based on the time we wanted to leave. However, one morning we waited over an hour for our vehicle. We sat in the tiny lobby area with our two young children for almost 60 minutes (we didn't come down to the lobby until 10 minutes after requesting our car). It was very frustrating and an impact on our activities for the day. Ultimately it was confusion as to which car the parking attendant was looking for that caused the delay, but the hotel did nothing for us. I expected to be reimbursed for part or all of the daily parking fee, but was given no monetary credit for our inconvenience. I realize that it was an unusual delay, but ultimately the hotel should have taken responsibility and offered us something for our troubles. Overall a great choice, but would think twice about staying if you need to have your car in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: All I really expected from Orchard Garden Hotel was a place to sleep...it met and exceeded my expectations. The rooms were pretty standard hotel rooms, the bathroom was average size and fine, but the bed was soooooo comfortable. I laid down for just a minute before we left for dinner and I took an impromptu nap...it was that comfortable. The parking situation was a little pricey, but I understand that is the standard in big cities so I can't complain too much. I stopped at the bar downstairs before leaving and it was also a little overpriced, but convenient. The hotel itself was actually really reasonably priced, given that we were staying on New Year's Eve and they were nearly completely booked. Also, the location was very conveniently located to activities. Overall, the room was nice, and the stay was good. The bed adds a full extra star. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: scoa
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean and bright rooms with very comfortable beds. The location is great and is very near to lots of eating places of all nationalities and steps from the gates of the interesting China Town. We did not eat here, but the restaurant and breakfast room looked very nice. They organised a shuttle bus for us to go to the airport for $15USD, which was two dollars cheaper than it was entering the city. We only stayed for one night, but wish it could have been more. It is not a cheap option, but I think it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good spot”
Reviews.Author: Tempo2
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful. Always cheerful and very helpful. This is quite important to me. The hotel is nice, but the tv had a very bad picture. It was an "off" brand. I'm not usually in the room much, so not hat big of a deal to me. If coffee is important in your room, you may want to bring your own or head out, as it's quite awful. Starbucks is almost across the street :) I also had a very difficult time with wifi reception in my room. I did accidentally lock my belongings in the safe without my code entered and they responded almost immediately to assist. Take note, the safe functions completely differently than any others I've ever used. Our friends did the same thing in their room. Valet is quite expensive, $40 per nt., but I'm sure parking is at a premium. We didn't need our car at all during our stay, as so much is within walking distance and there is a good bit of public transportation. Located right outside of the entrance to China Town. The bed was quite comfortable and we would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family loved Orchard Garden Hotel & San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CarLee64
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time researching before our trip - wasn't sure whether to stay in Fisherman's Wharf area or closer to Union Square. However based on the great reviews of Orchard Garden Hotel (both on Trip Advisor and Frommers) we went with Orchard Garden Hotel and we were very happy with our choice - especially after we experienced both areas in person! Fisherman's Wharf is very busy and touristy - even though you'll want to visit, not necessarily where you want to sleep every night for several days. One of the tipping points was that for our 4-night stay, the Orchard Garden offered the "Only in San Francisco Package" - Including 2 City Passes and breakfast buffet for two - booked on their website. The City passes actually saved us a lot of money over that 4 days - the 2 adults in our party got free admission to the deYoung Museum and the California Academy of Sciences (both wonderful and highly recommended), as well as our cable car ride. We only had to pay for the 2 kids. For breakfast at the hotel, 2 of us ate the buffet included in our package, and the other 2 ordered off the menu. The hotel was walkable to Union Square, to the Ferry building and we walked home from a Giants game. My teenage son was impressed with the hotel's commitment to the environment. The staff was helpful and pleasant. We booked the superior room with 2 doubles, and it was perfect for our needs. Taxis in the city are also reasonable to get around when you need one. Overall a great experience and we would definitely recommend the Orchard Garden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, the beds!”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the Chinatown gates, which is convenient for orientation purposes especially for first-timers in the city. Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed but the best part by far is their beds. So, so comfortable!!! Undoubtedly one of the best. They have plasma TVs and iPod docking stations. The hotel is very "green" and environmentally friendly from the lights to the bath products. Wi-fi works great and is free. Staff is very nice and helpful. They even had a wine reception on a Wednesday night at the bar and it was fantastic. I cannot think of any negatives and I would definitely stay there again next time I go to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Pchips
Reviews.Content: We booked on a 21 day advance reservation and received a great rate for August ( 164/n cancellable). We are used to staying across the road so we are familiar with the area and find it central to everything. What makes a hotel when all you want is a bed and a place to put up your feet after a long day of walking is good staff, a clean room, and a comfy bed. This hotel had it all. We stayed for 6 nights and the only complaints are minor. The water pressure at times was weak but always hot. I wish they encouraged use of their restaurant in the morning when all one wants is a coffee and muffin for the room or sit down(the chain of people coming back with Starbucks must drive the staff crazy). A price list of coffee and a la carte items would be helpful. The coffee makers in the room, the worst I have ever used. In the evening the staff would come to turndown our beds, nice touch. We had no problems with the wi-fi, we were always treated with nothing but respect . I would stay here again, if the price is right. Thank you for making our stay great. ( As a note there was some complication with our friend's room rate and reservation, they left her a bottle of wine and chocolates for her inconvenience-nice touch).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location”
Reviews.Author: 230green
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location and the staff was very helpful and attentive. Hotel borders Chinatown and within walking distance of many attractions. Rooms are large and very nicely decorated. Great amenities. Fitness facilities are available, but we did not use them. Also, there is a restaurant in the hotel that we did not use. There are many options for dining within walking distance. Would definately use this property again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: burquebabe
Reviews.Content: We love, love, loved this hotel. Reasonably priced, centrally located, clean, modern, quiet, friendly service, green attitude, and delicious food. I go to San Francisco about 1-2 times a year for business and this place was one of the best places I've stayed. I used to stay at the Westin St. Francis or Hotel Carlton, but will now be staying exclusively at the Orchard Garden from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Chic”
Reviews.Author: Mypetal26
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed in during our honeymoon in California. I was not sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised at how lovely this hotel is.. Perfectly located and extremely clean.. The facilities and decor here are second to non, but its best points are its modern contempory feel, extremely friendly staff and the beautiful views from the roof terrace.. The extra touches provided like fluffy bath robes to use during your stay only added to feeling like your living in a bit of luxury while your away.. It was hotels like this that added to our honeymoon.. Definately would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Green hotel without high Green price”
Reviews.Author: IslaBonita77
Reviews.Content: We chose the Orchard Garden specifically for the reasonable price and the Green rating. In doing so, I was prepared for certain "luxuries" to be missing, such as full-time AC. Still, I was there during a relatively warm stretch in October and found the room temp and air quality to be very comfortable once given time to run. The rooms have plenty of space and are decorated with clean lines and amenities. The beds and linens were super comfortable. This is one the few green things that you don't have to pay a higher price for and still get to feel good about doing! The only reason I don't give an "excellent" rating is the staff, which is quite unfriendly. I did not have any of the problems as some of the other reviewers, but even with things running smoothly they give an air of not wanting to be bothered. As for more specific, I agree with others that they are rather stingy with the breakfast and would recommended getting out in the neighborhood instead. In fact, I found the neighorhood feel to the location one of the nicer pluses. First-time visitors may want to be closer to the Bay and bustle, but people who want to troll Chinatown and Union Square (and avoid the noise of actually staying in Union Sqaure) will enjoy the Orchard Garden. Also, be patient, and you will find street parking close to the hotel. Even with meter time, it will run cheaper than the hotel parking ($40/valet).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: UtahSarahcat
Reviews.Content: Perfect location next to the Chinatown entry gate. Hotel and rooms were nice, staff was friendly, husband used the business center and was happy with it. Only real complaint was on our last night - there was an incredibly loud humming noise that never stopped. Sounded like a semi truck was parked in our bathroom. Thankfully it showed up on our last night there, so we just dealt with it. Not sure if it was the air conditioning in the room above or next to us, but it became pretty annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on TA reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel was immaculate, staff extremely friendly and helpful and location was perfect for everything we wanted to do. There are many dining and shopping options immediately nearby. The hotel is literally 3 doors away from the Chinatown gate, which was very convenient. The only room type available when I booked was a king, but they changed it to a double/double when we checked in, at no additional charge. The beds were among the most comfortable I've ever slept in, and the bathroom amenities were great quality. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in central San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Philauckland
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are large for san Francisco and the bathroom is a great size as well. The location is a 3 minute walk to Union Square and short walk to Westfield shopping, great restaurants etc. Restaurant on site although we only had the express breakfast the day we left. Staff at the Hotel are very friendly and eager to help with any queries or information. In room WiFi is free. Very quiet hotel. Check out the live shows at the Hotel Nikko in the Razz Room. Not expensive, great setup, small venue and very talented well known artists. 10 min walk from Orchard Garden. Remember to get online to check out happy hour in various locations.A great way to drink and eat cheaply. Side trip to Sanford University is worthwhile. Train takes about 45 minutes and it is about a 35 minute very pleasant walk (during summer!) to the University. The grounds and buildings are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but it it live up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ThanasisNa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next to China town and is very well located for shopping (at Union Square) or to walk around the city centre. However, we found ourselves "missing" a couple of shopping bags which we had left inside the room. I do appreciate that the hotel had a safety box and a very welcome front office but it is a fact that someone got access to our room and took our bags. Despite that experience, which I honestly find quite odd, the hotel is decent even though the charge the exorbitant 40$ for the vallet parking, which takes ages to bring your car. The Wifi is terrible and is almost impossible to place any Skype calls or download any attachment that is over 1 mb. That is of course in case you are travelling on business and you do take care about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in room with a terrace”
Reviews.Author: kasialouise
Reviews.Content: We stayed one Thursday night in one of the 2 rooms with an outside terrace on the 9th floor of the hotel. To reserve these rooms one must call or email the hotel directly. Rate is usually $359 plus tax. Ask for a 15 % discount. Our room 907 overlooked the Chinatown gate. Views of the street are over the sides of the terrace...front view the actual street is not visible. Room is fairly small with King bed, desk, minibar with refrigerator, closet with safe. One-cup coffee maker with additional pods available from the maid. The bathroom was very large with double sink, separate shower and bathtub. Good water pressure, towels pretty good size, soft. Bathrobes were gigantic, iron and ironing board in the closet. Many windows...all non opening. Terrace filled the room with light and made everything feel spacious. Terrace had table and 4 chairs plus 2 adjustable lounge chairs and an ottoman. Bed was very comfortable. Flat screen tv on the wall had a lot of channels, no MSNBC. No HGTV etc. Minibar price for a Heineken $6, M and M s $4 Cafe de la Presse on the corner. Irish Bank restaurant across Bush St had Guinness and shepherds' pie. Took the BART to Montgomery from the airport...an easy walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice and would go back”
Reviews.Author: 2wheeltraveller
Reviews.Content: Orchard Gardens turned out to be a great hotel. We stayed for 2 nights enroute to a Seattle cruise and were very comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful and rooms were great. The hotel is located very near to Chinatown and the San Francisco cable cars so everything was very accessible. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Small and clean with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: SBear62
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and they are what make this hotel. Nice rooms in a convenient location. Good breakfast and a comfortable bed. We felt very welcome here from the moment we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, upscale...but a bit small”
Reviews.Author: SoFlaFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the raves on Trip Advsior and while it was a really good bet (great location, great rate, nice staff) I might have had my expectations just a little too high because I wasn't exactly razzle-dazzled. The room was small, yet the bathroom was HUGE, which was a little odd. Nice bed, bedding, toiletries, but still a claustrophobic feel because it was just such a small space (and I don't like to spend *that* much time in the bathroom.) I did ask to be switched to a different room but it was sold-out. Anyway, all in all, still a good property, but if you're looking for something more than just functional in this location, you might want to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: jkritchey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Orchard Garden. The hotel was kept quite clean, and very nicely appointed. The location is outstanding. We walked daily to the Ferry Building, North Beach, Union Square and Chinatown. All within easy walking distance. Even saw the fireworks off the wharf from the rooftop patio, peaking straight down Grant Street. Convenient to all Cable Car lines, surrounded by good restaurant options. Room was well kept. A little tight, I wouldn't try to squeeze an extra in. We did not use the restaurant. My wife and I were very pleased with our decision.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ECO friendly Orchard Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxxxxx
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was great except you have to insert the room key into light control in order to activate the lights and ventilation. Suggestion: lights and ventilation should operate separately in the bedroom and bath. The restaurant had a very limited menu and was very expensive. The hotel is near shopping but you would have to walk up or down hill to get to them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal for your money”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyGP
Reviews.Content: We were here from East Coast to celebrate an anniversary. Were looking for something reasonably priced but updated and comfortable. This hotel fit the bill. Clean, spacious rooms and easy walking distance to restaurants, Chinatown, etc. Especially liked staying in a hotel that didn't feel like a chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little pricey though!”
Reviews.Author: kristinababy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden in May 2011 through a Facebook 'deal' we got (it wasn't much of a deal, 10% off, so $190/night)). The location was perfect, a couple blocks from Union Square, so it wasn't right in the heart of all of the tourists, which we preferred. Very close to everything you need from cable cars and restaurants and shops. We had a king size room with a 'view'. From the second floor, the view was the street and the hotel across the street, so that was a little deceiving and we wouldn't have paid the extra had we known that was the view. The rooms were small, but we expected that. But the beds and amenities were great! As was the large bathroom. It would have been nice if the fridge was empty or had room to put our own drinks in it, but it was full of mini bar drinks. The room was clean with plenty of towels. And we were happy with the free WiFi. The rooftop patio was amazing and we used it almost everyday after a busy day of sightseeing. Take a bottle of wine and just enjoy the view. We tried to eat at the restaurant for breakfast once, but we were in a rush and the server told us it would take over 20 mins to make our breakfast, so we had to leave. The customer service was good, but not great. Also, we did make use of the various recycling options provided in our room, which was great. Overall, if the rate had been a little cheaper I think we would have been extremely satisfied. But for what we paid, the hotel was good. I would definitely recommend it if you get a good deal on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2107
Reviews.Content: Room was awesome! Very clean and nice size(Superior room) This hotel is located at the gates to Chinatown. Very close to everything. we will be back/ A perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: zach42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June. Our room was ample, comfortable, clean, serviced daily and very quiet. Very comfortable beds - too comfortable - we slept in one morning. Not much of a view, but we only use room to sleep. The staff were frienfly and helpful. Centrally located in downtown San Francisco, we could walk to shops and restaurants and the 30 bus is close by which took us to the Ballpark and to Fisherman's Wharf. No need to have a car - buy the 3 day Muni passport at the airport. We took the Bart from the airport and stopped at Montgomery Street Station where it is a short 10 minute walk. We would use this hotel again if we get back to SF one day

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel but even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelingirlMemphis
Reviews.Content: We had booked a reservation with Orchard Garden but came back to SF early from Yosemite. Unfortunately the hotel did not have availability for this extra night and I voiced to them concern about what we would do the next day while waiting for our room. When we arrived at the Orchard Garden at noon the next day, the staff greeted us by name and had a room ready and waiting for us. Thank goodness they did because my husband had gotten a touch of food poisoning while at Yosemite (do not eat the sandwiches from the quick-stop at the Wawona Lodge!). The rooms were absolutely spotless and truly soundproof. The beds and linens were so comfortable. The staff was so gracious and the concierge so friendly. You cannot beat the location--just steps away from Chinatown and so close to Union Square. This will absolutely be our first choice on our next trip to SF, which I hope will become a yearly adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Code900
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this little hotel. The staff was great, the place was clean, the location was convenient and best of all, it was quiet. I would recommend this hotel and if planning to visit SF again, would definitely book with them.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MarkandTerry
Reviews.Content: We just returned to St. Louis from a week stay in San Francisco. We could not have asked for a better place to stay. The room was so comfortable and clean. The location was perfect for walking any place we wanted to go. The staff could not have been any nicer or more helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. Mark and Terry

Reviews.Title: “Healthy and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Cruizinquick
Reviews.Content: Always a great place to stay in SF. Special attention to nontoxic materials were used in the design, healthy bath products, and a nice interior design. Great breakfast cafe across the street on the corner too.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to call "home" while in the City”
Reviews.Author: blg2011
Reviews.Content: San Francisco has become an annual stop for us during our business travel and this was our second time to stay at the Orchard. The hotel staff were wonderful and always friendly! Every time we arrived at the hotel from our outings, they were quick to open the door for us and then we were welcomed back by the front desk persons (not only a greeting but a smile as well). Even the housekeeping staff were friendly and accommodating! The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and comfortable. The hotel is not only walking distance from Union Square and China Town, there are numerous restaurants only steps away including Mexican, Japanese, and Italian - not to mention a Walgreens and Starbucks just down one block. We look forward to staying at the Orchard Garden again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel, very well placed”
Reviews.Author: MarceloFenoll
Reviews.Content: Pros Good location, big room, clean and brand new amenities, good employees, two block from subway and union square, good restaurants nearby. Cons No near parking, expensive parking, no free breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, excellent service, a little bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Emski017
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for a recent weekend in San Francisco in between two business meetings. The bedroom was large, very clean and comfortable (we had two king size very comfortable beds - I travelled with my sister), the service excellent and the location great, 1 block from the cable car stop and a few blocks from Union Square. Plenty of restaurants nearly to walk to safely in the evening and a lovely French cafe opposite for breakfast or lunch. I would definitely use this hotel again but it was a little pricey despite all of the above!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bpr81
Reviews.Content: The orchid garden hotel was really good. Though pricey the rooms were well kept and neat. The location of the hotel was quite close to the union square and the BART station.( though i never did take the BART). The ferry terminal is walking distance and is a must see, especially the farmers market on Saturday. The rooms are a little small, but since i never really stayed long in the room, it was fine. And before i forget to mention, Chinatown is right next door ( literally). The restaurant inside the hotel was pricey, ad i never cared to eat there. I did have some trouble with the hotel though. The rooms were all overbooked, and when we arrived late at night, they transferred us to the Orchid Hotel nearby for one night( a sister hotel). I wasn't too pleased about this and hope the management looks into this issue. Not the way to treat customers who arrive late at night only to find that they have been moved to another hotel. But overall a good hotel and i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: canadellie
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Within walking distance to almost everything. Major shopping within 3 blocks...every store imaginable. Service/staff were excellent. Rooms were very clean, bed was excellent. As far as noise goes, doors closed very loudly and you could hear doors opening and closing in the hallway. Bathroom door was a slider and didnt offer the privacy as a regular door. Minor details as we didnt spend much time in the room. All the space you need for a good night sleep after a long day of touring. We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and good location within walking distance of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: oz_wongsta
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Union Square. Good location right next to the Chinatown gate and within walking distance of good shopping. Very friendly staff who were more than willing to help us shop for luggage accessories in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “so so, but the most uncomfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwan
Reviews.Content: Not that it's a bad hotel, it's got a great location, but their supposedly 'green' mattress is the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in - it was so soft that it gives me the worst backache after 2 nights. I was there for 6 nights and by the end I just gave up and slept on the floor which sort of ruined the experience for me. Initially, I was put in one of the worst room in the layout, with fire-escape eating up the room space, a wall for a view and right where the cleaning/maid station is. Only when I went and requested for a move was I put into a better room - definitely worth requesting. Limited room service - only at fixed hours and if they have a large group in the restaurant, they don't really have the capacity to cover room service at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Brand Spankin' New. Clean, sleek, modern. At gate to Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: NSpivak
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Orchard Garden recently and had a very nice stay. The hotel is completely redone with a very modern, sleek, contemporary design and feel. The rooms were very comfortable, and the linen and bedding divine -- a great nights sleep. This is an eco-friendly hotel, and had a few touches that one might notice -- they have recycle bins in every room, windows are all double pane for better climate control, but that also helps with noise abatement, and they have a key-holder inside each room where you must insert your key for the lights and AC to work. All done very nicely, so you don't feel inconvenienced, while still doing your small part for the environment. Staff was very accommodating from answering our questions about the area to assisting us with a later than normal checkout time. Well-located, this hotel is basically right at the gate to Chinatown, and 2 blocks from Union Square. We walked to dinner at a good Sushi restaurant literally across the street, and also to breakfast over at Sears Fine Foods. Valet parking is responsive and convenient, but comes with a hefty big-city price tag of $40.

Reviews.Title: “No sirens, no street noise, pfffff ...... YES!”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro1945
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this beautiful hotel downtown San Francisco. The room was very good furnished and the king bed was superb. The adjacent room was not occupied for 3 nights. The last night one single man stayed there and we could hear him talk to some guy on his mobile phone. We can imagine that more noisy people can disturb rest at night. The breakfast was OK but not stunning. We had breakfast for 2 times on the opposite of the street in the French Restaurant. Very busy on tiny marble tables but a great breakfast. The same applies for diner. The Orchard Garden Hotel offers a high quality diner, but the menu is very limited, so again to Cafe De La Presse with a great choice. The hotel staff is more than helpful in every way. The hotel is very clean. We payed approx. $ 800 for 4 nights (excl. breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff at a nice hotel near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: cr1ms0n
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff always greeted me when I walked by the lobby, and were overall very friendly. I had a delicious meal in the hotel restaurant, Roots, my first night. The bed was comfy and the room very nicely appointed. My corner room on the top (10th) floor faced two alleys and was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: marPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: this clean, newer hotel near the gates of china town and across the street from a great french cafe is a good place to stay if you want to be near to northern san fran and want to be a bit away from the fray of all the big shopping spots. the staff is helpful, the beds are comfortable, and totally worth the price which is very decent for san francisco. I have been there in february with my family and returned in march with a friend and was satisfied both times.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and green”
Reviews.Author: seapeace
Reviews.Content: Best location, excellent service, clean rooms, great oatmeal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: gregw72
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel lobby and rooms are very nice. Felt like a 4 star hotel. The rooms themselves are a little small, but then again consider the city where you are staying (they are still bigger than European rooms). Staff was very friendly. BART drops you off 4 blocks from the hotel, so no need to take a shuttle or taxi from the airport. We love to walk and saw the following by foot: Golden Gate Bridge Park, Coit Tower, Pier 39, Artistic Garden, Chinatown (1 block away), Lombard street and many more sites. I would highly recommend it. The only thing I would point out, and this is not a reflection on the hotel, is that we had our credit card number stolen I am guessing while eating out/shopping in Chinatown. I would suggest you pay in cash. The only thing we felt would have made it better is for a complimentary continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location .....”
