Reviews.Author: 3Family3
Reviews.Content: All and all we had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. Location is great as it is close to shopping and restaurants and is in the walkable area of SF. Easy walk to Union Sq. and Ferry Building. Staff was quite friendly and helpful (restaurant suggestions) although they forgot our wakeup call (set your own alarm !). The rooms are not large however the three of us managed quite well over our 4 night stay (2 dbls). The only negative was the food given that the hotel promotes their own restaurant. We were disappointed with our meals, in particular the room service food we had one evening, therefore ask for alternative suggestions. There was a fitness "room", very small though. Would we stay here again ? Most likely.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Thouv
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed this weekend and had a wonderful experience. The hotel staff was helpful and very friendly, the hotel was very clean and new. We had a room with a king bed; it was nicely appointed and quiet. It seemed very new. Great location and value. We have nothing negative to say about Orchard Gardens. I've recommended it to several others in the last day.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel at china town gates”
Reviews.Author: Anders_Falk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and it was really nice. Rooms were clean and the bed was super. Location is great just by the china town gates. The negatives; Bad sound proofing between rooms (we could here neighbors â€œtalkingâ€�) No view (from our room at least) Gym was closet size and 3 different walking machines. But overall a nice stay at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MadelineNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Orchard Garden hotel - the location is fantastic - situated next to Nob Hill and China Town - it's a lovely 15-20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The room was pretty basic but clean and a decent size. The staff was freindly. Breakfast was not included. Cafe le Presse is across the street - great breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraills
Reviews.Content: We had never travelled to San Francisco before, and we were looking for a place to stay that was fairly central. Based on the other reviews, and the cost, we picked the Orchard Garden Hotel, and we were very happy with our choice. First: Location. It was only about a 10 minute walk from the BART, albeit a tad uphill. It is also literally steps from the entrance to Chinatown, (not even half a block away). Only a few blocks from Union Square, and like i said about a 10 minute walk from the BART. Streetcars and buses are nearby as well. Second: The hotel itself. This one is a great find. The attached restaurant is wonderful, we had a great breakfast there one day. The rooftop patio is a must if you want to get a good view of the surrounding area. Staff was friendly and courteous, allowed us to store our luggage on our last day while we walked around one more time! When we go back, we will definitely be staying here again?

Reviews.Title: “A great find with great rates & the greatest staff!”
Reviews.Author: kttravelgal
Reviews.Content: I love San Francisco and regularly visit the city at least 2-3 times a year. Since I'm a priority club member I normally stay at the Mark or the Intercontinental, and mix it up with the W. But this past weekend my friend and I were on an abbreviated schedule where we were going to arrive late in the city and then leave early the next morning, so we just wanted a place to crash for the night on as little money as possible without sacrificing cleanliness, comfort and convenience. Expedia had a deal on the Orchard Garden for $111.75, and very positive reviews, so we booked it. What a find! First off, you really can't beat the location -- at the foot of Chinatown, it is literally walking distance to the Financial District and Union Square. For everywhere else, do take advantage of the valet parking even though it's $40.00, the doormen and valet were absolutely wonderful -- they immediately unloaded the car for us when we were checking in, and whisked the car away -- only to have to turn around and bring it right back when my friend and I decided to drive down to the wharf instead of getting drenched in the rain. But they didn't mind and never lost their cool or grins (which were genuine & not plastic!). In fact, the customer service was the best that I've had in any of the hotels in the city, bar none. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, they were all warm and welcoming and extremely helpful. As for the room, it was immaculate and tastefully decorated, and had all the similar amenities that you would find at the Mark or the W. The only issue was that the "view" was of a large messy dumpster -- but so what, once the drapes were drawn we forgot all about it. The beds were extremely comfortable, and yes all of the eco-touches are commendable. But like other reviewers I found the toilet annoying -- the handle was hard to flush, and the flow was too weak to do a proper job. I have a low flow toilet at home, but it still does a nice job, so it must be the brand. Oh well, a minor blip in otherwise a very satisfying stay. At the cheapie rate breakfast wasn't included - but Cafe de la Presse is directly across the street, as is a Starbucks, and then there are plenty of dim sum places right around the corner -- so it wasn't missed. Will definitely be staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel ... wonderful, courteous staff ... convenient”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: First timers to the Orchard Garden (but have stayed at sister property = Orchard) ... Grade: A- (very good), but bordering, close to a B+ Let's get to the review: HOTEL: A very nice small, boutique-ish hotel that is literally at the foot of Chinatown on Bush St... steps from the Chinatown gate (Grant Ave). It is very convenient to obviously Chinatown, Financial District, shopping, and easy walking to Union Square & Market St. The staff was great, from front desk to porters and cleaning staff ... always greeting us with an acknowledgment and a smile, anywhere in the hotel. An A+ for the staff. The lobby is minimal, as expected for this type/size hotel. Upon entering, you are greeted with a warm front desk welcome, and to the right, a split with entry-way to their in-house restaurant, which we did not try (too many other options in SF!). After check-in, we walked a corridor (with decorative, metal perforations to see into the restaurant) to the elevator (qty 2). First impressions: clean, well-kept hotel. Additionally, this is a "Green hotel" ... we like that too. ROOM: Our room was very nice. Decor was very light in tone, saturated by neutral beech/blond colors in the wood for headboard, credenza/desk, nightstands, and some muted greens (in comforter/duvet). Very safe decor, maybe a bit too monotone. Comfortable Queen bed with bonus of a comfy couch (seats 3, and probably pull-out for extra people) in a sitting area by the window. View = alley & back of other buildings ...and we did hear the much-dreaded garbage-truck-pick-up in the evening (no biggie... if in the AM, might have been a minus). Fairly standard accoutrements of flat-TV on wall, mini-fridge, pay-for-snacks/drinks, in-room safe, and robes. TV is not movable, so viewing from the couch was a strain, at best. Bathroom was good sized, and very clean with basic toiletries. Some minor minuses that brought our grade down a tad: the toiletries were very small, so tubes of shampoo, body wash were barely enough for one person, let alone two. Additionally, pressing the lever for the toilet felt like a harder push than normal, and it was not a very powerful flush either. OTHER: The hotel goes "green" by offering recycling baskets (total of 3) for trash, as well as presumably a low-flow toilet. Again, we had to press the toilet handle hard (felt like it was lifting a bucket) to create the pressure, thus a weak flush. More obvious in their "green" effort was the requirement to place the room key in a slot by the entrance to initiate the electricity = European style. If you leave the room and take the key, lights go out, except for a bedside lamp and the alarm-clock. Works for us! SUMMARY: Yes, we would recommend this hotel for a nice, warm, friendly, comfortable stay in SF. It is convenient, stylish enough and very clean. We liked the sister property, Orchard Hotel, a tad more, but not that big a difference. Very good hotels ! Happy Hotel-ing !! Pics to be added shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Facility”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyTwp
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel is as good as it gets, One of the Best Value Hotels in SFO. We loved the location, walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square, cable Cars, most attractions. The rooms are small but very clean and the most comfortable beds with wonderful European comforters. The small bar in the lobby is probably the most friendly in the city. A great find! And GREEN friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: tojopop
Reviews.Content: We got trapped by the East Cost blizzard and needed to hunker down for 2 days in San Francisco. We have stayed at The Orchard Hotel several times before but they were sold out. We were lucky enough to get a junior suite at this sister property and we were delighted with the hotel. The location is great-literally at the gates of wonderful and must see Chinatown. Our room was comfy and the bed was terrific. Big bathroom with free standing glass shower and tub. The staff were lovely and you are surrounded by great restaurants and wonderful shopping on Union Square. Not only did they take us in, but they were gracious enough to allow an early check in as our flight was cancelled at 9 a.m. It was a rainy and cold day and we were so happy to check in and re-think our holiday plans. Hats off to this wonderful hotel and it's kind and generous staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our SF Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: lddaw
Reviews.Content: After our first visit at the Orchard Garden Hotel several years ago we have never wanted to stay anywhere else. The location is perfect for our needs: good restaurants, ACT, Union Square, and just wandering. We have no complaints whatsoever. In fact, it only gets better, feeling more and more like our home away from home. Many thanks for the conscientiousness of all involved in making The Orchard Garden Hotel such an inviting place to return to. Linda Dawson

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and apple pie too”
Reviews.Author: MsAmmann
Reviews.Content: Got the apple pie holiday package for Cheistmas Eve and Christmas Day to experience Davies Hall Concert, Union Square, Chinatown and great restaurants. Stayed at the Orchard before but not Garden. Both are great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good use of space”
Reviews.Author: realtorromero
Reviews.Content: Walking into the room of this nicely appointed boutique hotel took my breath away. Being a bit on the claustrophobic side I was taken aback by the lack of square footage. A second look and I had to admit it was was done. Very comfortable bed and a couch too. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and green. Fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: lauriecven
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and was exceptionally clean and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place that would enable us to mix business with pleasure for a weekend seminar, so location was key for us. The Orchard Garden Hotel, just a couple doors down from the gates of Chinatown proved to be a great location for what we were seeking. We were a pleasant 15 minute walk from the Embarcadero across from the Ferry building where our seminar was taking place. This area was a great place to explore the art and crafts at the flea market and outdoor skating rink, as well as the farmer's market and the great shops across the street at the Ferry Building on Saturday. Union Square was also just minutes away by foot. However, the Orchard Garden Hotel offered a less commercial reprieve from some of the other neighborhoods in the area, with some cute cafes (ok, and a Starbucks right across the street) and relative quiet. Rooms were simple and small, but clean. The bed was very comfortable. The staff at the hotel seemed quite friendly and accommodating, upgrading our room to one with a view of the neighborhood. We didn't try the in-house restaurant "Roots", but the menu did look tempting. Not much of a lobby, since the restaurant occupied that space - I kind of missed that aspect - but otherwise, quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LVCandCo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best possible location: at the entrance of Chinatown, 2 blocks from the stores going towards Union Square( 4 blocks away), close to Nob Hill. The bed was incredible: soft goose down pillows and comforter: like sleeping in the clouds. The staff was super helpful and gracious, they made our stay super pleasant. We thought the hotel was perfect, a great value, and a super find in the heart of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfy and nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: RedMerny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we thought we were the only ones on our floor, it was so quiet! Great staff, location and comfortable rooms. The only thing I can pick on is that there was not a table in the room, only a desk with 1 chair. So it was hard to share a snack or play a game since there was no where to do that. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks for making our San Francisco week-end so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fira100
Reviews.Content: We spent our Thanksgiving weekend in San Francisco. This hotel is perfectly located with restaurants, shopping, BART station, and major tourist sites near by. The Cafe de la Presse crossed street has the best croissants and breakfast. The room is modern and clean, staff are friendly. We also found a garage on Bush Street (two blocks away) that we can park our car overnight at about $9.00. Overall a wondeful stay and we will definitely use this hotel when we are in San Francisco next time.

Reviews.Title: “Always, Reliably Clean & Up To Date. A Great Value In A Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: Chablis28
Reviews.Content: There really is no sacrifces made by staying here. The place is in a great location. Super clean, up to date and one of the few properties in SF that is new construction in it's downtown Union Square neighborhood, besides it's sister property a couple blocks up the hill that would likely stand up better in a earthquake. The best restaurants in SF are all mostly within walking distance and the nearby Ferry Building area near the Bay Bridge has better views than Fishermans Warf and less trashy, in my opinion. This is probably our 5th time staying at one of the two Orchard properties and I feel no need to scout out another downtown SF hotel in the future assuming they keep these two up as nicely as they have so far. Most of all I love a smaller property like this were you are less likely to run into a group of conventioners who take over your hotel. These guys don't seem to lust for the big groups and really treat the individual traveller well.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PhotoVisualArtist
Reviews.Content: We returned for the third time to this hotel, as we really like the ambiance, service, location and convenience. Therefore, for a special celebration of my husband's birthday, this was our place of choice once again! We love the fact that they are a Green Hotel, from the construction to the many details. The cleaning is done with green, non toxic products, and the place is VERY clean, without those obnoxious smells or the toxic feel that other places have. I particularly love the light, both coming from the windows as well as from the very well place and pleasing lamps, and the feel of the materials chosen for the bedding. And find the bathrooms very pleasant, both aesthetically as well practically (with details such as a make-up mirror, that greatly helps when I have to take off my glasses!), all spotlessly clean. This time it was even better than before: as returning costumers, and honoring the special occasion, they offered us a room upgrade and a complimentary bottle of wine! Located right by the gate of Chinatown, this hotel is just the best place to walk out and go shopping, sightseeing, or to go to a conference or meeting, as we have done before. The back and interior rooms are very quiet, with very good light, and some even have views of Chinatown. The front rooms (we had one only this time) are also quiet, large, spacious and very comfortable, the kind of comfort that we value: soft and pleasant materials, non toxic environment and pleasing aesthetics, wide windows, good light, nice materials for curtains and armchairs. And the great quality of all the supportive technology: flatscreen TV, plenty of plugs for all our computer stuff, wireless internet, etc. Only good things to say about their service, that was very attentive to our needs and always friendly and present. They were able to accommodate our needs for an early check in, and were very quick to respond to any further requests we had, In previous stays, we have tried their excellent cocktails at their bar and loved them (they use these exquisite organic vodkas and juices as ingredients), and had good meals at their restaurant. We particularly recommend their happy hour deals, as the food is good and the drinks are amazing. This time we just went out and back many times, enjoying the many attractions of the city. We cannot think of any other place we would prefer for a few days in San Francisco: we highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: luigivis
Reviews.Content: Very very pleasantly surprised, nice boutique hotel, great rooms, great beds, ample new bathrooms, free wifi, chic upscale location, I will go back next time in SFO, hope rates do not scale up that much in the future. Kudos to the Orchard Garden, keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff but good locationa and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Initaurus
Reviews.Content: Good location, it is not located near cable cars which make enormous noise. Two starbucks located nearby so very handy for getting breakfast. Also you can walk down to the Westfield shopping centre for nice lunch and shopping. It takes about 15 mins on foot. Modern, clean and roomy double-bed room we stayed after asked for a quiet room due to noise from air con generators on the roof of the building next door. The doormen and 3 counter staff were completely rude to us, which ruined our stay. Despite the hotel advert on free T1 internet connection, you will get only 500mbs and need to pay for T1 access. The fitness centre has only 3 running machines so if you are thinking of doing weight training, do not bother. Clean bedding but the pillows and duna were too thick. The mini bar shuts down when you go out, thus everything you put in the fridge will go off. Even if we left a key inside, the fridge were off while we were out. Twice our key did not work and the staff asked us to present our passport even though he checked us in. I recommend this hotel only who do not care about hotel staff courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Problems”
Reviews.Author: Gigantes2010
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this location about ten times this year. So I feel I know this place. I like the location. It is modern and clean and green. On my last trip the front desk lost my reservation and I ended uphaving to relocate to another hotel. They sometimes do things like that at the Orchard Garden from time to time and, when they do, the staff seems at a loss. One time I checked in and they had a crane immediately outside my window setting up at four AM. Nobody bothered to tell me about that and they surely knew. That sort of thing. They are nice enough but sometimes a little short on what they choose to communicate. Check out the view from the roof garden. The interior rooms are much quieter than the street.

Reviews.Title: “Super restful and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: sgtmother
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 8th floor facing Bush Street and it was QUIET. We heard no street noise at all and no noise from any adjoining rooms. There was absolutely no smell whatsovever to the room. Completely neutral. The mattresses were firm and the pillows were light and fluffy, as were the sheets. The bathroom well designed and the organic bath products were good, too. You have to put in your room key card to turn on the lights. One item that did not work was our fridge and the internet was down in our room, but the staff offered to remedy that. Good location -- adjacent to Union Square, Chinatown, and within walking distance to the Ferry Bldg at Embarcardero. I highly recommend this hotel and I've stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels domestically and in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jmoyn9
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden is a pleasant, comfortable place to stay. The room was not large, but quite adequate; bathroom spacious. Opt for the rooms with street view. Their "Only in San Francisco" package is a good bet--includes Muni-Cable car passes, museum admissions, boat tour and continental breakfast. Delicious scones, croissants, fruit for breakfast. Really tasty french fries at the bar. Convenient location--right next to Chinatown Gate, only a few blocks to Union Sqare and Market Street. For dinner, try the European cafes on nearby Belden Alley.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully done "green" hotel and will stay again and again!!”
Reviews.Author: ekrichardson
Reviews.Content: Everything was spot on with the Orchard Garden Hotel! From the staff at the front desk, the gentleman at the door, even the housekeeping. It was clean, friendly and very accommodating. I would recommend this to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but positive comments @ this modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Netherlands80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed it fully. Location was perfect and away from all the noise but still close enough to walk to Union Square. Modern and chic hotel and huge bathroom. I would stay here again. (i'm from Vancouver, Canada) LEED certified is a bonus too and FREE WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smbulak
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific hotel, probably our favorite on our 9 day stay in 5 cities in California. Great rooms, great bed, great location, great price--especially for the downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cincygyrl
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is right next to Chinatown Close to shopping and restaurants, within walking distance Clean, bright, simple, modern decor Excellent staff, everyone was friendly and attentive Roots restaurant for breakfast (the food was delicious; healthy fare, just my style) Comfortable room; bed was amazingly snuggly LEED hotel (loved the recycling bins in the room) Water pressure in shower and sink was great Cons: Breakfast buffet in the Roots restaurant was scimpy for the price ( i ordered off the menu)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but came at peak time and price was high.”
Reviews.Author: wine_lover18
Reviews.Content: I would stay at this hotel again as long as it was not during a major conference. I ended up paying the maximum rate due to that but given that the rates are generally very good, i would rate this hotel as one of the best for the money if your timing is right. Excellent in service, cleanliness, comfort, location, food quality, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: buddy1997
Reviews.Content: Seven of us were attending a football game in Berkeley and decided to stay in San Fransisco. The Orchad Garden was the perfect choice, with a great location. Close to all the main areas, yet away from the traffic congestion of Market St and Union Square. The staff was very friendly and helped us to arrange transportation to the game, and Roots was a perfect spot to come back to "drown are sorrows", after we lost!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Friendly, great location and refreshingly Clean!”
Reviews.Author: kcaz510
Reviews.Content: Two girls traveling for a Fun Get-Away. We stayed 4 nights, shared a room and felt safe the entire time. Friendly staff that greeted us coming and going every day. They had great suggestions of what to do & where to go...The Bell Man always got a cab for us if we needed it. Location is THE BEST! On the Corner of Bush and Grant, right at the start of Chinatown! We loved it...love the Orchard Hotel and the whole staff! The "Roots" resturant was great too! Can't beat it for the price and quality! KC & Sheira 9/2010

Reviews.Title: “Convient location”
Reviews.Author: OCBB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and close to China town. The staff were not very attentive and consistently provided the wrong directions and did not seem to understand English all that well. Overall the hotel is a good value and a great location for all public transportation spots.

Reviews.Title: “An Emerald Gem... I heart luxury GREEN hotels!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TishaTaylor
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel is an emerald gem in SF. It is located near everything and literally at the shiny gates of Chinatown. It was an intimate boutique hotel with a serious passion for sustainability. Everything had a green twistâ€¦ Mother Nature greeting you in the lobby - key operated lights â€“ eco friendly soaps! The rooms were elegant and quiet and the beds were super comfy!!! I enjoyed my stay and just knowing I was in a small way protecting the environment will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: PlaneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had not been to San Francisco in 19 years and wanted a "non chain" hotel. This one was exceptional. Location could not be better - right next to Chinatown Gate. Deluxe room was spacious and terrific bathroom. Two suggestions: First, skip the breakfast buffet - it's pretty basic - and eat across the street at the Cafe de la Presse. Second, park yourself in the Sutter Stockton Garage. You won't find any better bargain for parking anywhere in the city. We look forward to our next stay at the Orchard Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dewsweeper1
Reviews.Content: Really nice and private All the reviews we read were on the money Can't say enough about the Staff Super friendly and helpful Very clean and quiet We had a great stay and highly recommend this hotel Definitely go to Dotty's True Blue Cafe on Jones St for Breakfast Stay away form the Eagle cafe on Fisherman's wharf tourist rip off WAY over priced A nice little French place not far from the hotel was Rue LePique - highly recommend Also try Venticello- really nice small atmosphere with a killer view of the golden gate at night Ask for the table downstairs by the window Lefy Odoule's turned out to be a really fun place with corned beef and pastrami sandwiches for 6.95 and a piano bar that was raucous Go later in the evening A really great bargain was the ferry to Sausalito $16 round trip and you get a dynamite boat ride across the bay to Sausalito - goes right past the rock Watch out for those hills - Last recommendation - GET A TROLLEY PASS for $20 Well worth it They charge $5 a person each way and you WILL ride the trolley a lot PS Could not leave out Tony's Pizza in north Beach the bartender there is a chemist He'll make you anything and then some San Francisco is a great city to visit! Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the City!”
Reviews.Author: Coolsvpmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Garden for 4 nights and found the hotel to be everything we had read on trip advisor. The room was spacious and the staff were very pleasant. Being right on the edge of Chinatown and Union Sq meant we had easy access to everything we wanted to do. We stayed in 4 hotels on this trip total in Northern CA and the Orchid Garden was the nicest for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for location and quality!”
Reviews.Author: fancypants70
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 17th wedding anniversary celebration trip to SF and Monterey. I used all of the info gathered right here on TripAdviser and I'm SO happy to have had a reliable source. This hotel's location was perfect- so close to the trolley and so easy to get to shops and restaurants. The room was bright and clean and we were rather impressed with the free wifi (high speed had a fee but the lower speed was free and worked great for internet surfing) as well as free movie checkout. We stayed in a very upscale hotel in Monterey which did not offer free wifi nor free movies so, in retrospect, this was a wonderful perk The only downsides were the bed (a bit hard) and the lack of knowledge that the staff seems to have. No one could recommend where to get great coffee (shrugged their shoulders and suggested Starbucks, which there seem to be two of on every single block). BUT, for the price, I still rate this hotel quite high. It exceeded our expectations and we would happily recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice!”
Reviews.Author: DRWade
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and then again in 4 days for the remaining 4 nights of our CA trip. The hotel was great. Highlights were location, cleanliness, and staff. The staff was helpful and very nice. When we returned (after renting a car and driving down the coast and to Yosemite), they upgraded our room to a larger room and gave us turn-down service and chocolates at night, which our teenage kids really liked. The location couldn't have been better. It is right next to Chintown, so we spent much time walking those streets, but we could also easily get to other areas by taxi. (Public transportation is not too great in SF, so for a family of 4, taxi's were best.) There is a great bagel cafe nearby, called Posh Bagel, which we ate at almost everyday for breakfast, except for one day when we had to go to a quaint crepe place we found. ("delicious!", so look for that as well!) We would get extra bagels to go so that if we got hungry while sight-seeing, we each had something to hold us over until a late lunch or early dinner. The only one thing that I would have preferred is to have either two queen beds in the room, or at least one of them to be queen size. There was plenty of room for the larger beds, and with a family of four we had to share. I am used to a queen bed with my husband! One additional suggestion: go to the top floor ("garden' or "terrace") for a great view and pictures of some of the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: SambaDC
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a gem situated in the best location in San Francisco for discovering the city. This was my third trip to SF in the past year and I've stayed at a different small hotel each time, hoping I'd find one that was perfect. I have! It has 80 rooms which affords both privacy and attention from the staff. The staff goes the extra mile by promptly servicing your room and turning down your bed in the early evening. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are modern with good water pressure. They also have a free DVD movie collection you can borrow from, so I watched Alcatraz after taking a tour of the prison. Many great restaurants are located close by for dining and even when the nearby financial district gets quiet on the weekends, it's a pleasant walk to North Beach or the Embarcadero. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For What It Is”
Reviews.Author: Cawwee23
Reviews.Content: On our way to Hawaii we stopped in San Fran and enjoyed this quaint hotel. It's a no frills kind of hotel, but very clean. The bed was awesome, slept great. There was even a DVD player in the room and free internet. The only set back was the room was a little small. A great place to stay if you are looking for an inexpensive hotel in the heart of San Fran. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: cyberBeach
Reviews.Content: We chose this for the location and the reviews. There are no drawbacks or sacrifices related to the fact that the Orchard Garden is an eco-hotel. The rooms are very good, the mattresses are very very good, the bathrooms are very good, the size is good. It is in between small SF hotels with tiny rooms and aging interiors, and super-metro hotels with big bustling lobbies. There are very experienced staff persons at the desk, a very new interior, smallish but very comfortable high-end rooms. There's no big in-room desk area nor a couch or a coffee-table, but you don't have to crawl over the bed to get around the room either :) . Very clean and quiet. The location is great for Chinatown, Union Square, Market St., Cable Cars, Trolleys, and a short walk to Columbus. Check out Cafe de la Presse's co-kitchened "Wine Bar" for coffee and a croissant for breakfast across the street. We are going to stay here again on our next trip up from LA.

Reviews.Title: “Down Comforters and Comfortable Robes”
Reviews.Author: powerpuffgrrl
Reviews.Content: Great, relaxing, quiet stay during SF Marathon weekend. The bed was phenomenal; cool, soft sheets and a down comforter helped in recovering from the Marathon. Quiet, quiet, quiet. We really enjoyed our stay. Next time, we'll eat at Roots, for sure. Lunch at Irish Bank was good, pub fare. Cafe de la Presse was nothing to shout about; crowded, uncomforable atmosphere, aloof staff and basic, uninspired food.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice for a city break in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: frenchy_10
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel very well situated and with all amenities you need!

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best, Amateur Attempts at Premium Service”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravelsATL
Reviews.Content: I know good hotels, having stayed at them worldwide -- and this is not one of them. Design is dated, service is awkward, amenities/products are cheap. It all adds up to an amateur attempt at best. The "greenest" hotel in San Francisco? A few different light bulbs, cheap toilet paper and leaf-print wall-paper, carpet, drapes and bedspreads just doesn't make it so -- it's a cliche at best. But the WORST part of this hotel is the horribly thin wall construction: if you want noise from kids, TVs, sex and family fights just like they are in YOUR room, then go for it. If not, stay away. Super location...reasonable price...but worth it ONLY if you plan to spend very little time at this "wannabe" hotel. Well intended, but not well done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful start to a two week vacation”
Reviews.Author: Good2GoUSA
Reviews.Content: Found the place fairly easily with the help of GPS. Good Lord! I had no Idea it was so close to the Gate of ChinaTown. ( I scored!) Lobby is pretty much split down the middle by a cool clean modern looking restaurant/Bar....Very nicely appointed rooms, super quiet, secure, awesome bathrooms (best toiletries ever EO) comfortable beds and even housekeeping staff was cheerful and charming...Great to know we were staying in one of the few officially recognized Green Hotels...(LEEDS I think) Front Desk staff VERY helpful patient and kind..not snooty or rushed like some staff can be Charming AND Trendy...How do they do it??.:) Coffee shops, trolley stops great area..........Loved it....I WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasmine53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orchard Garden Hotel 2 nights and really like this hotel. The location is very good, right at the Chinatown Gate. Easy for exploring Chinatown and also can walk to Union Square and Westfield Mall within 10-15 mins. The room is good sized, spotlessly clean. The bed is also very comfortable. We just wish that breakfast is included. We try the restaurant at the corner (opposite the hotel) for breakfast, but not much impressed. Maybe it's better to try dim sum in Chinatown instead. Anyway, next time we go SF, we will surely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice green hotel - strongly recommended if you can get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: olive231
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - we loved our stay at the Orchard Garden - we really favor staying in "green" hotels and this one is a really nice one. It's new, clean, quiet and comfortable and we truly enjoyed our day/night there. We will go again - if we can find a good deal for it ! The usual costs listed (170-200 per night) are just not a good enough value for us. You can stay in hotels just as nice for 130$ a night in the same neighbourhood - or in a really snazzy one for the price they are asking for. We stayed there for 110$ a night (Expedia special that the hotel matched for us) and that was definitely a better than average deal. Their "value packs" seem really good but are not always available. The warmth of the staff and overall service were average but professional - and they were more than willing to check us in early and hold on to our bags the next day. The business and fitness center are really small but do the trick. We were a little disappointed that the restaurant closed early when they were not busy. Our room was great - quiet, clean, pretty, no weird smells, and the bed was very comfortable. Nice bathroom and minibar + TV too, and free WiFi. The neighbourhood is great - right by Chinatown, 2 min walk from Union square, 5 min walk from Montgomery Bart station. We found our new favorite restaurant about 10 min away on Market called Amber (Indian cuisine).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Green, Accomodating and a great rate.”
Reviews.Author: nonstop74
Reviews.Content: I like to lean towards four star hotels, and if the reviews are above average, I will choose an eco-friendly hotel if there is an option. Orchard Garden was exactly that, and at a great rate. I spent my first Friday & Saturday nights there, then traveled outside the city, and planned on trying another location in San Fran when I returned the next weekend. The staff, location and the room were above my expectations for the rate, so I decided to book the following weekend there too. When I asked to book again, they gave me a nice 15% discount without even asking them to. Can't say enough good things about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Orchard Garden!”
Reviews.Author: suzrap
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location. We stayed there only for one night and got a free upgrade to a terrace room, which was gorgeous. Staff was very nice, helpful and accommodating. We were able to use the business center to check in for our flight and print boarding passes. Although we didn't visit it, there is a roof top terrace. Wonderful hotel, reasonably priced - we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: sailormd
Reviews.Content: spent two nights in the junior suite (complimentary upgrade)......very, very quiet.....super clean , absolutely wonderful bed (like the Westin bed), huge shower with frameless door, giant porch with table and four chairs and two lounges.... view of city.......very friendly staff.....the scones are the best I've ever had....baked fresh on the premises....coffee is excellent (and I am fussy about coffee--most places have terrible coffee)....bart is very close, hotel is adjacent to chinatown, union square a short walk, ......this is the place to stay..and of course very green.....

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: xacta
Reviews.Content: Although only able to spend two nights here we were impressed by the friendly and helpful staff, the large and comfortable room and also the location - quiet yet very central. We left with the feeling that any request would have been handled professionally and attentively.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, dodgy toilet...”
Reviews.Author: JemmaReading
Reviews.Content: I am all for eco-friendly hotels and recycling etc, but when it directly relates to the room I find it a bit much. Our toilet didn't flush well or consistently, which I assume was due to water saving efforts on the hotel's behalf but which ruined our experience at the hotel. We had a two double bed room which was relatively small compared to other rooms we stayed in. The location was excellent though and we could walk anywhere we needed to go. I found the staff fairly unhelpful though an unfriendly which was not what I experienced in other American hotels. The location of this hotel meant our stay was satisfactory but the toilet and staff meant a stay that could have been excellent was only average.

Reviews.Title: “Beware-- Won't Honor Advertised Specials, Bait and Switch Rates!”
Reviews.Author: anjelika
Reviews.Content: I wish I had the opportunity to rate my experience at this hotel, but I never got the chance to even book my reservation. I had done a lot of resarch on hotels for my upcoming visit to San Francisco in two months, and was very pleased to find the Orchard Garden Hotel. When I did more research, I discovered in the "specials" section of their website that they offer a discounted rate of $149 for a superior king room when you book three consecutive nights ("San Francisco Triple Play" special valid through 8/31). When I clicked on this special and attempted to book my stay, however, it only offered me the room at the regular rate of $213 a night, $64 more a night! Assuming this was just an error with the website, I called the reservations desk. They couldn't explain why I couldn't book at that rate either so they transferred me directly to the hotel. The hotel staff politely explained that this rate has blackouts, and that I must have been trying to book during the blackout. The special didn't mention blackouts, and I pointed this out. The special is worded plainly and said that if space was available, the offer was valid through 8/31. No fine print, etc.- I was very careful to pay attention. Long story short, they admitted that this is used to entice customers during times of low vacancy and that the rate is only available arbitrarily, i.e., there may only be one room available at this rate on a particular date. I'm upset because it is extremely deceptive to say that a promotion is available until a certain date if space is available (which it was), and then not honor it. I asked if they would honor their special, but they said that they weren't willing to and that the higher, regular rate is the best they could do. Bottom line is that they advertise specials to interest you, then try to charge way more. As a result, I'll go elsewhere...don't waste your time trying to use one of their specials or discounts. I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Luger11
Reviews.Content: We were able to take advantage of a Spring special which made the hotel quite reasonable. It is a very nice boutique hotel that is small and convenient. It is very well located so getting places is very easy. The rooms are really nicely decorated and good size for being in the middle of the city. Across the street is a great cafe- Cafe de la Presse which has excellent food. There is a parking garage a block away that is inexpensive as far as city parking goes. If we go to SF again we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanboro
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our recent stay at the Orchard Garden. Check in was quick and efficient, staff was friendly without being pushy, the room was very clean and well appointed and the beds were incredibly comfortable. We took the BART from the airport and it was an easy 10min walk from the Montgomery station. The location is perfect with restaurants, shopping, Chinatown etc all within walking distance - we didn't have a car and walked everywhere. I don't normally eat in hotel restaurants but we decided to have breakfast in the Roots restaurant on our last day and I have to say it was the only disappointing experience at the hotel. The restaurant was empty but we had to wait for staff to come out and seat us; I ordered the eggs benedict only to be told they were out....how can you be out of eggs??? The quality of the meal and the coffee was very poor compared to our previous meal at the Cafe de la Presse across the street. But I wouldn't let the breakfast experience put me off staying at this hotel again - everything else was just too good to stay anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel for SFO center. Helpful and amenable staff”
Reviews.Author: TerryUK70
Reviews.Content: Welcome was good. Room compact but well equipped. Everything worked. Didn't eat in hotel but restaurant looked good. If you bring a car be prepared to shop araound for parking or pay $40/24hr. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect centrally located SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladybugAZ
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 5 night stay here. We found that this hotel was within walking distances to most of the major sights of the city. We had a non-street facing room and even though it didn't have a view except for the brick building next door, it was a plus because we didn't have the street or people passing noise. Each floor had about 12 rooms which meant not having a lot of hallway traffic and noise either. The beds were comfortable. The staff was very helpful and polite. Tip- if you need a ride to the airport, ask the doorman to order you a town car instead of a taxi. Cost about the same and much nicer and safer ride. Don't miss the nearby Farmer's Market on Saturdays, at The Ferry Building, which you can walk to. Definitely would stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “It would be easier to rate if they would have upheld our reservation”
Reviews.Author: cheer4kd
Reviews.Content: After receiving several suggestions from a friend who lives in SF and reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, my boyfriend and I determined to book our first stay in San Francisco at the Orchard Garden Hotel. We decided to reserve our room directly through the Hotel's website using the prepay non-refundable rate. We arrived at the hotel to check in to find that the Hotel allowed a large party to stay longer than their reservation which left no rooms for any other existing reservations. The hotel did not have enough courtesy to call us to let us know that they have moved our reservation to their sister hotel, the Orchard Hotel. Not to worry though, their sister hotel was just two blocks up the hill within walking distance with our three suitcases and two bags. Although securing us a room at their sister hotel, we prepaid to stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel, if we wanted to stay at the Orchard Hotel, we would have made our reservation at the Orchard Hotel. The fact that the Orchard Garden already had our money and switched us to a hotel that we did not know anything about without even giving us a call to let us know was disappointing none-the-less. We expressed our disappointment and in return received a shoulder shrug with a sorry and a card for a free glass of wine at the hotel bar. We have filled out a survey from the Orchard Garden Hotel that we received subsequent to checking out of the Orchard Hotel in which we expressed our dissappointment, unfortunately, due to the lack of customer service, we have still not received a follow up from hotel management. Remember, word of mouth is the best type of advertising!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel steps from gates of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: gacook
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at this "green" hotel because of great rate (book directly from hotel's website) and location near Chinatown. This was our 1st visit to SF so we really had no clue where to stay. We took a chance on this little gem in the financial district and we're glad we did. The staff was all incredibly helpful and very efficient. They gave us great recommendations on restaurants and local stores to go to. We were able to use their business center free of charge to print tickets. The room was large, bright, and comfortable. The small fridge in the room was great to have cold drinks on hand. You really get into the "green" spirit since you need your room key to turn the lights and power on; there is a recycling center in the room, as well as boutique organic toiletries and spa robes. Word of advise - park in the garage up the block and across the street, since valet parking is $40 per day and the garage is $26.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Garden Hotel - Great Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina2all
Reviews.Content: Over Spring break I traveled with my two teenage children, 12 & 14 and stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel. The location was fantastic. We were only a few blocks from Union Square and a block from Chinatown. The hotel was very clean, modern, and quiet! Our rooms were amazing. We had two adjoining bedrooms on an upper level and it was like having a little condo., plenty of room. We were able to go almost anywhere from our hotel using the public transportation system. There were also plenty of restaurants nearby and lots to do. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orchard and its perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TahoeLakeshore
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel everytime we come to San Fran. I love the location right next to great shopping, Union Square, China town. Best French cafe right across the street. The service is always great and the rooms always clean and pleasant. See you next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JullyMI
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed it a lot. Excellent atmosphere. Restaurant is excellent too. Personal is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: ahtravel
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research on various hotels in San Francisco before finally reserving with Orchard Garden. I'm glad I made that choice! This hotel is beautiful inside - clean, contemporary and welcoming. Our room was also very nice (although we were placed in a room right next to the Housekeeper's closet). Everything was clean and worked properly. Even though the hotel is "green", I definitely didn't feel like I was giving up an amenities in order to help the environment. The Orchard Garden's prices were very comparable to other hotels in the area, so I felt we got a great value for the price. The restaurant looked very nice and smelled great, but we didn't ever eat there because it was much more expensive than other restaurants in the area. The location of the hotel is perfect for tourists and shoppers! Union Square is just a couple of blocks away, as is the Cable Car line. You can also walk to the Muni Station, which is just about five blocks away. My only complaint about the hotel is the business center. We used it various times to buy event tickets and print boarding passes. There were only two computers, and neither worked very well. If you're planning on using a computer a lot while you're there, bring your own laptop! I also wish they provided refrigerators in the rooms, but I could live without it.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel from housekeeping to front dest and in-between!”
Reviews.Author: jkm1234
Reviews.Content: we've stayed at the Orchard Garden twice before; an amazing hotel, fairly priced for a staff that's dedicated and attentive; the food at their restaurant, "Roots" is exceptional. 4.9 STARS

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: carney-photo
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden couldn't be better. We found it through an article about Green or eco-conscious hotels and we were delighted to find that it was so conveniently located as well. We took the BART in from the airport which was a breeze, got off at the Montgomery station and walked the three blocks to the hotel. Would we recommend this hotel to friends? Yes, yes, yes, we would tell them to go to San Francisco just to stay there. My husband worked in San Francisco in the 60's so we set out to visit his old haunts. Imagine his delight to realize that the hotel is a block from Sam's where he ate lunch almost every day and our delight to find the wonderful CafÃ© de la Presse right across the street. We were there to visit our daughter who just moved to Oakland so we had dinner at Chez Panisse and visited the Cathedral of Light. Both of them were breathtaking experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal, GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMH18
Reviews.Content: Supreme location, lots of attention to detail at this newish, small, "green" hotel. Rooms were on the small side but VERY well-designed, net, and clean. Superb housekeeping staff. Great for business (easy walk to financial district) or pleasure (also close to museums, shopping, attractions). I was worried that it might be noisy (adjacent to Chinatown gate, lots of activity in the area), but it was VERY quiet and peaceful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ktizme
Reviews.Content: We spent a Friday evening at this hotel recently and would definitely stay here again - hopefully for a longer stay next time. Our friends also had a room as we were attending an event that evening together. (We both got terrific rates for SF! About $110 per night.) The staff were wonderful, they upgraded us to a larger room facing the street, the linens were beautiful, the bed comfortable, the toiletries fab -- everything was very peaceful and serene. (A wonderful night's sleep - very quiet!) We also enjoyed the restaurant downstairs for "Happy Hour" wine with free hors d'oevures (which turned out to be garlic fries or a choice of wonderful salads - practically dinner for us!). The location is really wonderful - very walkable to Union Square and beyond. We had a croissant and coffee at Cafe La Presse in the morning and then a walk through Chinatown up to the California Cable Car and around the block. Very lovely - quiet time in the financial district - perfect weather (we lucked out!). The only minor hassle was waiting for our car when we checked out -- lots of other folks waiting as well - so staff were challenged to get all the cars to the guests leaving in a timely manner with one attendant. Our friends waited much longer and the staff actually comped their entire stay! Wow. That's NOT your typical hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Green Features, LEED Certified”
Reviews.Author: In2Green
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was LEED Certified and the price was fantastic compared to the hotel where my conference was located. Beautiful, but narrow room, very comfortable, 1/2 block from the Chinatown arch. I love all the green features the hotel has incorporated. The restaurant, Roots, was very good, though only one person was working as bartender and waiter. Only downside (for me but not for everyone) was that the room was TOO quiet. I had a hard time falling and staying asleep without my usual ambient noises around me (dogs, kids, spouse, etc.). Would love to go back with my spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Lovely Room! Superb Staff! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: markbenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel for one weekend night in April 2010. I love the Hotel, the location, the room, the staff. All made for a perfect stay. We were taking friends from out of the country for their return flight home and chose the Orchard Garden for our their last nights stay in the US. We were not disappointed! You can't go wrong here. Even though the hotel was close to capacity you seldom saw any other guests. The rooms were quiet and restful. The bed was so comfortable. You're a half a block from the Bush Street enterance to Chinatown, 3 1/2 blocks from Union Square, 2 1/2 block for the Powel cable car line, 1 block from parking. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat”
Reviews.Author: BitBeachy
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Francisco with my family, including two teenagers. This hotel was quite a find. We've stayed at the larger hotels in SF, Parc 55, Holiday Inn in Fisherman's Wharf, but we loved the smaller size of this hotel. The french cafe across the street was very good and so convenient. There is also a wine bar next to Cafe de la Presse that was very good. We had wine and a salami and cheese plate that was very tasty. The past reviews have already said it all; conformable beds, great shampoo, friendly staff, best location for walking the city. One thing I was happy to find out about in these reviews, and I'd like to state again, was the parking. We drove here from the Central Coast. So we had a car to deal with. Parking is expensive in the city. It is $40 per night at this hotel, which is typical. We used a previous reviewers advice and parked around the corner at the St. Mary's parking garage on Kerney and California. Friday night was $32, then it was only $7 for Sat. So you can save some cash with that option. Overall, we loved this location. We will more than likely stay here again if we can the great rate that we got from their website, which beat out all the other travel websites for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Orchard Garden”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinsFinest
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Orchard Garden. Great location just blocks from Union Square. Front desk was friendly and helpful assisting me with directions. Hotel has a great complimentary business center w/printer that I utilized. Had a very nice mini-suite that was nicely furnished. Hotel was environmentally friendly with a key card activated power and separate recycling receptacles. Room was well appointed and bed was very comfortable - slept like a log. Tip: to save money on valet parking, which the hotel charges close to $50 per night. Self-park at the Sutter Stockton garage - 1 block away. I paid only $23 there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value, would recommend it unreservedly”
Reviews.Author: RobUKNL
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, very friendly and helpful staff, great location, excellent value for money. Haven't got a bad word to say about it (with the possible minor exception that the fitness centre is very small, but for the rate we paid we were please to HAVE a fitness centre!).

Reviews.Title: “A Cheat!”
Reviews.Author: CristyMa
Reviews.Content: Most reviews are right: this is a nice little hotel and a great location! Yet, there is no ventilation, no bathroom door, and a air condition system that spreads the bathroom smells throughout the room. Bu hey, if none of these issues matter to you, then it is a great place to stay! My husband and I stayed at the Orchard (not Orchard Garden) a few years back. We were exited to return to the hotel and got a great deal at the Orchard Garden. The problems started after resting a few hours in the room: inadequate ventilation and poor air quality. First, the windows are plugged (presumably according to California law) and there is a tiny vent underneath the window, but this is not nearly enough for fresh air. I complained about the air quality and was advised that it could be adjusted. I asked "how," and soon realized she was talking about lowering the temperature in the room. I still do not understand how making it colder would make the air quality better...... The ventilation is so poor that the gets humid and uncomfortable even with the air condition on after two normal showers. Frankly: it was unpleasant. Second, there is a sliding door to the bathroom. It is thin and doesn't close all the way. Hence, there is NO bathroom privacy! Third, the air condition system is set up so that the air circulates in both rooms, thus resulting in the smells from the bathroom spreading in both rooms. So, unless you are comfortable sharing bathroom smells and noises with you partner, this hotel is not for you. SF is a great place for vacation, but I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't disappoint...great location, surrounded by much to do!"”
Reviews.Author: Nomossnomore
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at the Orchard Garden. The staff helped in every way. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. We're looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality amenities, clean and quiet, but tight quarters.”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoHome
Reviews.Content: Great location at the foot of the Chinatown gates, and just above union square. Rooms have quality amenities, but are tight quarters. Interior room was nice and quiet for downtown. Clean- one of the few hotels where the carpet didn't gross me out. Had a tub to bathe my son (many downtown hotels do not). Our in-room safe wasn't working. Got up too late to have breakfast (black-out curtain kept room dark), so couldn't try restaurant as no lunch available. Would definitely stay here again because all you want in the city is a clean ,quiet place to stay in a great location. LOVED that the hotel is "green". Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff and exceptionally clean accommodations”
Reviews.Author: jamcgovern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden for our first trip to San Francisco and picked it -- after reading reviews -- for its location, green status and price. Although we did not have the promised mini-fridge in our room until the second day, and that one did not work properly, our stay was excellent. The room was small, typical for San Francisco it seems, but immaculate. And I don't think I've ever slept in a more comfortable hotel bed or used a better hotel-provided robe. It's a little weird that the bathroom door is a slider and does not close all the way or lock, but it was just my husband and me, so it didn't matter. You cannot beat the location -- about 5 short blocks from Union Square and a block from the Chinatown Gate as well as close to all forms of public transportation. The staff was very helpful and friendly and gave great recommendations for restaurants. We also got a great deal booking directly through the hotel's website and pre-paying-- three nights in a 10th floor room with a view for $362, including tax. Where else in San Francisco can you get that?!

Reviews.Title: “A great little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: planningnextvacation
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. The location is perfect! Steps away from upscale shopping, great restaurants and museums. The picturesque Chinatown Gateway is next door to the hotel. Also only a couple of blocks away from cable cars and street cars which make getting around the city very easy and fun! The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful. Our room was a little small but was very clean and looked great. The bathroom was great -- roomy and spotless. The bed was very comfortable and appealing. We are picky and would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Green peace of mind!”
Reviews.Author: AyceTV
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden was without exaggeration a most peaceful and pleasurable experience. Not only is it elegant - but it's entire construction and story are fascinating. I highly highly (a thousand times!) recommend it to anyone looking for a 5+Star experience at a reasonable rate - who is also environmentally conscious. It was such an impressive stay that it prompted me to write the review below...ENJOY!! http://aycetv.blogspot.com/2010/02/ayce-travel-logue-orchard-garden-hotel.html

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, very clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: deltadawn50
Reviews.Content: We had to make a last minute trip to San Francisco and I saw a great deal on Orbitz for the Orchard Garden Hotel. After reading the other reviews, we booked it and had a really great stay. The location is on Bush, just outside of the China town gate and a few blocks from Union Square. The good rate was probably due to the fact that we went at an off peak time. We were also upgraded to a superior room on the 8th floor (with no additional charge), with a view looking out over Bush. The room was average size, but very new and clean with great bedding and a larger nice bath. This is a smaller hotel, but very nice. The only downside is that there is no parking. You can valet for $40 a day or park in a city garage 3 blocks away for $33 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel I ever. Housekeeping went over and above.”
Reviews.Author: jimhi
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Orchard Garden and this is by far the the cleanest hotel i have stayed at ever. I ran my finger across every nook and cranny and could not find a trace of dust or dirt. Our stay was for a total of 4 nights and we managed to get a last minute rate, otherwise it would have been at least $50 more per night. The hotel is virtually brand new and is maintained very well. The decor is simple and tasteful without being pretentious. The beds were comfortable if a little on the soft side and the pillows are large plump. We had a very restful sleep after our 14 hour trip on Christmas Day from Australia and were amazed how quiet the rooms were with the walls well insulated and the door meeting flush to keep out the corridor noises. Even though we were here for leisure, this hotel would be also be ideal for the business traveller particularly when you discover the complimentary wireless internet. The negatives were probably the hotel front desk. Although being generally friendly they probably weren't the most helpful or professional I've seen. I was kept waiting while some of the staff were having a personal conversation and I did see a staff member having his dinner behind the counter. Fortunately with the free wireless I was able to find out for myself all I needed to know. Housekeeping on the other hand was EXCELLENT and very professional. Not only were our beds turned down on returning each day but when we went out to dinner, we returned to find once again the sheets were opened for us at the corner in preparation for going to bed. This is something that you won't even find at 4-5 star hotels. The hotel is located right next the the Chinatown gates which proved convenient when trying to find good food at very good prices. It is about 3 blocks from Union Square which is about as close as I think you would want to be if you want to avoid the large crowds. Having stayed at 3 other hotels within SF I will be returning to the Orchard Garden for my future visits. Did I mention that it was clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - great staff - great price!”
Reviews.Author: msjacqmills
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I take quick weekend trips to SF a few times a year. We normally stay at a Hilton or Marriott - but, from now on Orchard Garden Hotel will be our goto hotel. It's smaller and doesn't have the grand lobby. But, it's very nice, clean, wonderful and helpful staff. Our standard room had a great lay out, and a spacious bathroom (for an SF hotel). The king bed was just as comfy as a Hilton or Marriott. Free wi-fi, a mounted flat screen, cd player AND an i-pod/i-phone docking station. The location is great - a few blocks to Union Square, Chinatown steps away. Le Central Restaurant right across the street! Plus, it's very environmentally friendly - not easy to come by in a hotel - but, will become increasingly important in the near future for all of us. If I had to find something wrong with it - there aren't any HD channels available on the HD tv's. We watched part of Vikings/Cowboys play off game and the picture quality sucked. I definitely feel like we hit the jackpot by finding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Knottsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights following a recommendation by a friend for their sister hotel then finding a great internet deal for this one. We also liked the 'green' credentials. After a long haul flight we were very impressed to hear we were being put into a junior suite as our double room was not ready. The room was lovely; spotlessly clean, big bathroom, comfy slippers and gorgeous smelling toiletries. The only criticism was the tea from the all-in-one coffee and tea machine which, being a English girl, tasted awful! We did not have breakfast included but enjoyed the french cafe across the road. We got a shared taxi from the airport and found that the location allowed us to walk to the main areas and hop on the trolley to areas further away. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others, especially if you can get a great internet rate like we did to stay in a boutique hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Every once in a while, you're surprised.”
Reviews.Author: slightlyannoyed
Reviews.Content: That's for staying at the Orchard Garden. I'm camping out here for the next two days until I can move in to an apartment close by, and booked the room because of the less expensive rate. I knew I was going to get killed on parking the car ($40 a night), but that's the only downside, and not their fault (someone else owns the parking garage). Outside of that, no complaints, because... - It's near EVERYTHING. Union Square is two blocks away. The touristy part of Chinatown starts two doors away (seriously, complete with shops where they'll work with you on price). The Ferry Building and Market Street are within walking distance. The restaurants outside of the restaurant are great, and read like an international guide (Irish, French, Thai, Hawaiian, Chinese, Italian, etc.). A few bars close. Two Starbucks, close. - The rooms are smartly designed. The place is environmentally friendly -- you have to plug your room card in to turn on the lights -- and very comfortable. They aren't elegant like the Fairmont or Hopkins, but the clean design and nice color scheme reflects the environmental nature of the hotel. The design of the room uses space well (the television is mounted high above the desk area = smart), and the bathrooms are nice. The bed is super comfortable, and so was the desk area. - The staff is super friendly. Other than not getting an early check in (remember, boutique hotel, small staff), they were more than accommodating to all of my requests, watched my car full of my things while the valet came, brought my bags up when I did get in, and even made an extra trip right away when they accidentally brought the wrong bag. Trusted them with some expensive things, and they didn't go missing. - I didn't get nickel and dimed. The WiFi was free. The business center is free for prints, one time. There wasn't water that had a price tag, and I didn't feel like I was going to get charged for everything. Nice, considering the state of travel now.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RegTerry
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 consists of 4 teenagers. We spent 4 days in San Francisco right before Christmas. The staff was a huge help, because, although we had travel books, we had never visited SF before. The staff gave us great suggestions. It's a great location for using public transportation. I would highly recommend this hotel. My only complaint was that in order to get adjoining rooms, we needed to get the junior suite. As mentioned in an earlier review, it is not a very big suite. It was nice to NOT be on the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel - not a mega hotel at Embarcadero- but pricing issue...”
Reviews.Author: jidoo
Reviews.Content: Very modern and clean yet warm. Seems recently renovated and very nice front desk people. Right near Chinatown and Bart etc. Nice rooms though mine had no real view...maybe that's why it was a decent price. Not much of a lobby but thats' OK- small but decent restaurant. At late night, the area around the hotel is just a little sketchy; if youre a woman traveling alone it could be a problem. One other problem: I was quoted a price that I was promised would be matched from my on line search, on the phone, but when I got there, I was not allowed it for one administrative reason or another. It wasn't a big difference so I didn't argue it much but there was no reason for that given, that was plausible. So get your best price on the phone, get a name, and date and be sure they honor it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and green!!”
Reviews.Author: yogini27
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel....especially for its value....Rooms were very clean and comfy beds and the location was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “The smallest suite I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: MMSANDFCS
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. I did see comments about the size of the rooms but not about the suites. Their "king" size bed was not a king either, they confirmed at the front desk that it was a king size bed, we have a king size bed at home and unless there's a new "green king" someone is terribly mistaken. Our room was so small that we had to put our luggage in front of the bathroom and hallway doors. The bathroom was huge and spacious but not the place for luggage. Upon arrival we had food and drinks to put in the refrigerator but the cabinet had a sign in it that said that their mini bars were being serviced so I requested a refrigerator. We did get one that only had room for what they were selling and they were right, it did not refrigerate at all. It was not communicated that they would be bringing a refrigerator that did not work and throughout our four night stay we felt that any communications we did have were very abbreviated as well as incomplete. It was the holidays but the hotel did not seem too busy so why this was happening we were not sure. We also had read the reviews prior to our stay and decided against bringing a rental car and paying $40/day to keep it at the hotel, the location was so great that we walked to catch buses and street cars and then rented a car to leave the city, upon checkout, down on O'Farrell Street close to the hotel. Overall the hotel was very clean but we were disappointed with the service, size of our suite, and we could not keep our wireless connection which was very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, centrally located and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: YatriFresno_CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was peaceful amidst the whirwind of activity in Union Square. Orchard Garden and Orchard hotel are my faves in the city. The rooms are clean, green and spacious. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value, fantastic location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyblack
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a hotel promotion to visit San Francisco for the weekend with our family and were wondering what to expect. We were very pleased by the beautiful lobby, inviting bar and restaurant, and friendly staff as soon as we walked in. Our room was spotless and excatly as pictured on the web site. A huge plus is the wonderful location. Next door to the Chinatown Gates, across the street from Cafe de la Presse and Starbucks and two blocks from Union Square (on the nice side). Highly recommended for a business or family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for SF Christmas Shopping!”
Reviews.Author: GailandMeg
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Orchard Garden as an early Christmas visit together to do our shopping in SF for a long weekend. We LOVED the location of the hotel for walking anywhere we needed to shop, its green LEED rating, and great room with fluffy white duvets that we called "our cloud beds." Totally a good value with the prepaid internet rate. No need to rent a car--we took BART from SF airport and walked the two blocks from the Montgomery station. The Roots restaurant was a lovely dinner spot--I had the speciality Coconut Mojito which was stuffed with fresh mint and a yummy Dungeness crab on Mac and Cheese--the ultimate comfort-food entree. Friendly staff!! Gail, Washington DC

Reviews.Title: “Nice but perhaps over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: DctrD
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the philosophy and the decor of the hotel; however, I was disappointed by three things: (1) Despite their assertion that lowest rates are always found on their website, I was able to find a significantly lower rate via online resource (in this case, Hotels.com). Of note, I had even directly emailed the manager regarding rates, but was simply directed back to their website. (2) I had trouble picking up the "free" wireless in my room, and found my connection to be exceedingly slow. (3) Upon checkout, a charge for a minibar beer appeared on my bill although I never even opened the minibar; while this was ultimately removed, it should never have been there in the first place. I hope the hotel can improve these small annoyances, because it has the potential to be a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly well-done plush eco-hotel in heart of San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Quite new at the time of my visit, the Orchard Garden Hotel was more than just a great moment of pampering, it was a moment of pampering where one felt they were doing good to the earth instead of dumping harmful chemicals in one's wake. The bed was infinitely comfortable, with top quality high-threadcount linens and duvet. Very modern TV, electronics and stying within the room. The "green" bath products were plush and wonderful smelling. The restaurant in the lobby was nothing short of San Francisco excellent. (Were it not in this city dominated by competitive cooking and foodie-ism, it would be a high standout on its own.) Staff was incredibly welcoming and warm, clearly proud to be a part of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: travel_enthusiast2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great, the location is near to everything: Union Sqare shopping, Cablecar, Financial district and Downtown, etc...Hotel itself is clean and nice and not noisy at all (in comparison to other hotels). We enjoyed our week long stay and would definitely return here the next time around! BTW: go and check the terrace with a great view that let's you relax for a bit during the content-packed days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and serene.”
Reviews.Author: CAKitty
Reviews.Content: Close to Union Square and Chinatown yet a great retreat from hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Everything so fresh and clean”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJane
Reviews.Content: The room was small - European feel - efficient space - comfortable bed -clean fresh bedding - everything spotless - beautiful down comforter - good pillows - location is excellent - close to Union square - Chinatown - BART - good restaurants - we were very happy to be able to get an online special with very reasonable rates

Reviews.Title: “Had every intention of staying there”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 4 nights into what I thought would be a King Superior room. With hindsight having checked our reservation email carefully, it states a King Interior. This is something I would not have gone for, but it says it on the email and I missed that. On arrival, we were given a room on the 2nd floor right at the back of the hotel, the room was not very big but was nicely furnished and clean. The view was of a back courtyard only. I suppose this is what they call a King Interior!
