Reviews.Author: Newyorker765
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden is conveniently located downtown, absolutely spoteless but without much character for the price. Our double was so small it was hard for two people to get by each other in the room. On the other hand, the beds are super, so if you are just using the hotel for sleep it's fine.We stayed in #208 facing Bush, and while the double windows kept out most street noise, the same could not be said for the interior . Could hear next door conversations, and had no "do not disturb " tag to hang on New Year's Eve. So Housekepping knocked at our door at 9AM ,as well as our neighbors, to a collective and vocal"go away" which could be heard all over the floor. So much for sleeping in on New Year's Day. Not much thought on management's part. Maybe less focus on the "Green" and a little more investment insulating their rooms from each other. All in it seems overpriced for what you get in value, unless you can get a deal--under $150

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Price, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: memily68
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orchard Garden hotel twice now, once for business and once for pleasure. Both experiences were fantastic, we fell in love! The rooms are clean, the beds and sheets are exceedingly comfortable, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The convenience of free wireless and movie rentals are very thoughtful and show the care that the management puts into the facility. The location right outside the gates of China Town make wandering the city easy, and its close proximity to the Powell St. BART station make travel a breeze. The icing on the cake is the specials that the hotel will run, lowering it's nightly stays to under $150, as well as it's fantastic happy hour specials (buy a drink, get an appetizer for free). We recommend this hotel to everyone who asks, so enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, service, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: krissyla
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at Orchard Garden over the holidays. I travel a lot for business, but this was for a family vacation with my 12 year old son. Of all the hotels I have stayed at in my life I would rate this among THE BEST!!! This is primariily because of the very friendly staff that aims to please. We needed help setting up my son's new video game system that he got from grandpa and wanted to try on the hotel TV. Even though the hotel engineer had left fot the day already, someone came up from the front desk and gave it his all until he got it hooked up! Beds and bedding were very comfortable, and room was exceptionally quiet even though on second floof on the street. Everything clean and worked well. It is not big-- my son and I with the two double besds and all our stuff pretty well filled it, but it was well-laid out and comfortable. Only drawbacks, low-flow shower is less strong than I like, but this is good for the environment, and it was sparkling clean and worked well. And while service was very friennly, the restaurant food was a little too interesting--organic, creative, some tasty, some not.

Reviews.Title: “1000 US dollar deposit withheld from ny account”
Reviews.Author: hans_wadenvik
Reviews.Content: A bunch of Swedish doctors attented the newly held ASH meeting. We had rooms prereserved ar Orchard Garden San Francisco. The rooms were prepaid by the travel agency. Despite that the hotel took a deposit of aroung 1000 US dollars fom our credit card. Despite commenting on the incorrect action taken, nothing happened. We left the hotel on monday and still, 3 days later these, these money has not been released and can apparently not be used by me. I have e-mailed the hotel three times and they only show their arrogance by not responding. Certainly, I will not attend that astablishment again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience at Orchard Garden”
Reviews.Author: jicken
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations! It is elegant AND green. No chemicals, no perfumes--I breathed easy the whole visit. The staff members were also exceptionally gracious. The location is also very good, half a block from the Chinatown Gate and just a few blocks walk from anything you want to do in downtown SF, or the BART or the bus if you want to go farther. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: janrez
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and were not disappointed the second time. The location is excellent. The room is fresh and new. The bed is extremely comfortable. And we love the green aspects. The use of the computers in the business center is very useful also. If you have not been to the Ferry Buliding yet, you should definitely give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It”
Reviews.Author: czheng
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Orchard Garden was comfortable and effortless. Everything was perfectâ€”the staff is courteous and accommodating; our room was beautiful, spacious, and clean. We had the added satisfaction of supporting an environmentally-conscious business without experiencing any drop-off in quality. I was a little worried about the "low-flow" fixtures in particular, but the water pressure was plenty strong. And the linens were every bit as soft as you'd expect from a luxury hotel. The hotel's location is optimal: right next to Chinatown, a stone's throw from Union Square. Lots of shops and restaurants. And very close to BART (getting to Orchard Garden from SFO was surprisingly quick). The hotel's restaurant, Roots, has excellent food and excellent service. And the coffee was the best we had while in San Francisco. In all, I can't recommend this place highly enough. Easily the best hotel stay I've had in years...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: cat7104
Reviews.Content: Got a great last minute rate but I probably would have been happy paying the standard rate too. Very attractive, super comfy rooms, excellent staff - friendly, very helpful, got a great recommendation for dinner nearby. Also a terrific location, just down the street from the Chinatown gate.

Reviews.Title: “good location, service okay”
Reviews.Author: tirsabel
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based off of reviews on tripadvisor. The green factor is nice if it is important to you to stay in a green hotel. The rooms were decent sized for a city hotel. the bathrooms were actually decent sized also. The shower pressure was a little on the low side, then again going along with the green theme they were water-saving shower heads. the location is very central and we did get a good deal on orbitz at under $200/night including taxes but we were staying in early november Two annoyances and they were pretty minor but both in service. the first night we tried to do a pay per view movie and it took about 45 minutes for them to figure out that it wasn't working. I don't think the staff even knew if the system was down or not they just thought it wasn't working. It took several phone calls and two visits from the staff downstairs and in the end it still didn't work. The next evening we were told by the front desk that their system was down and they apologized again. It was kind of annoying that if the whole hotel's pay per view movies were down - and no one working that night knew. It seems that someone ought to know as opposed to taking an hour to figure it out - we definitely would have made some other plans. Also, we used the valet service and had an early flight. Since they said there was a closing time on the valet (2AM) we figured there was an opening time and wanted to make sure we'd be able to get our car at 630AM in the morning. so we called downstairs to find out and again took about an hour to confirm we'd be able to get our car out in the AM. Again these things weren't huge but it just made the staff seem uninformed regarding a few basics about services at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jkolod1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the entrance of China town, which is nice if you wish to shop and ear there. It's a long way from the bay. Upon checking in we asked if our room had a view of the town and were told no and there was nothing they could do. When we got to the room there was only a view of another building and some a/c units. The room was small and there was no space in the bathroom. The TV is old and the bed is nothing special. We did not see the "green" factor. If you think you can tell the difference between a "green" hotel and any other hotel, think again. Over all the room is comparable to any Holiday Inn. The lobby, however, is very nice. The staff was friendly, but not helpful. The internet room has two computers and was busy every time I went down to check email. Only book if you will only be stumbling into the hotel at a late hour and leaving early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjjnnn
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in an excellent location. Great beds, modern decor, delicious breakfast, and good value too!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Rosy500
Reviews.Content: Oct 31,2008 Canada We chose this hotel because of the trip advisor's reviews so,we feel that we have to give our opinion. The room was smaller than we expected but the bathroom was spacious.Everything is new so in very good condition. Very clean,also. It is true that the beds are very comfortable. We have the same opinion as Cadaquest12 regarding the green policy. Location is perfect. The service is definitely outstanding. Everyone answers your questions and go out of their way to please you.Their recommandations were all good. We feel that we paid too much when we read the price the others have paid. We paid $349.00 +tax 49.00 (no breakfast) for a room with 2 beds ,no view. Very quiet room as we requested. We stayed 3 nights on oct 16 and we would recommand it to other people if they can get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinClare
Reviews.Content: We spent three enjoyable days in this hotel by default. We were travelling with 5 other friends and noticed 5 days before departure that we had booked another hotel to the one our friends were staying in. Having trawled the web we liked the look of Orchard Garden and its location. It is on Bush Street which is central(beside chinatown gate) and within a short ride of everything. It is san fran's first eco hotel(visit website). A warm welcome met us on arrival and our room (double) while a bit on the small side was perfectly formed. Extremely comfortable bed with crispy bedlinen, free Wifi, flat screen TV. Marble bathroom with good lighting and toiletries. Buffet breakfast was included in our deal,juices,breads, fruit, cheese, cold meat,excellent. Breakfast menu available at an extra cost.Staff discreet and polite. Overall this was a very positive experience for us. We felt safe and cared for. 300$/night B&B

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean and Oh So Comfy!”
Reviews.Author: OnlyChild29
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice, clean quiet hotel in the midst of the hustle in San Francisco this is it. Comfortable beds and pillows and a friendly, helpful staff completed a perfect 4 night stay. Will gladly stay when I visit again. Within walking distance of BART and street cars. Extremely pleased with my well researched choice and it's even better knowing that I chose enviromentally conscious accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: spe03
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, nice rooms (well equipped, attractive and very clean) and top location right by the gates of Chinatown and the financial district combine to make this a top choice for business or pleasure. (Well OK then - probably more likely to appeal to business travellers, given that it's not cheap for a 3-4 star hotel. Parking at 40 bucks a night also soon adds up, although that's the case pretty much anywhere downtown.) The 'greennness' is an additional nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! Can't wait to return to the Orchard Garden & SF”
Reviews.Author: Mystycka
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. Very pleasant employees were always helpful and the room was amazing. The location was ideal - easy to walk to anything, including muni transport to everywhere we needed to get to. We discussed a return to San Francisco and we can't imagine staying anywhere else. High speed internet was very fast and easy to connect to. The room was spacious and bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and the bathrobes were a fantastic addition. We got an interior room, so the view wasn't amazing, but we didn't care - the room was, one of the best we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Desparately_seeking
Reviews.Content: First off location - can't beat it. Two blocks from Union Square, slap bang next to China Town, two blocks from the Powell Street cable car and a leisurely walk to the Ferry Building or Fisherman's Wharf via Colombus Av. The rooms are not huge, but perfectly fine for a couple - we stayed five nights and it was good for us. Everything is relatively new, nice king-sized beds, super fresh, crisp, linens. Flat screen TV and DVD player, fridge, minibar, wardrobe and a really clever sliding door to the bathroom which mean't you got lots of room in there to play with. We loved the toiletries which were refreshed everyday. Plus the turndown service in the evening where we got fresh coffee for the machine. This isn't a hotel with a view, but we got a good, quiet room up on the 8th floor which we slept so well in. Other reviews of hotels in SF have complained about noise from sirens etc but this hotel was quiet as a mouse. We didn't even have any early morning wake-up calls from the housekeeping staff like we have at other hotels. The staff on the front desk were extremely helpful. Directions, advice about visiting things, recommendation for late night take aways - whoever you asked, they were very knowledgable. We didn't try the restaurant but it was surprisingly busy at lunchtime with local business people and the smells wafting from it in the evening were delicious. We stayed here during an eight month trip around the world and having stayed at a number of Hyatt's, Sheratons, Holiday Inns etc it was refreshing to stay somewhere independent, small-ish and with people who actually treat you as an individual and not a credit card walking through the door. I would highly recommend this to anyone staying in SF. We got a decent rate through expedia - it's not cheap but compared to many other hotels in SF in was good value. The free wi-fi was also excellent, fast and never went down throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prink_123
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Orchard Garden. The location is wonderful -- next to the Chinatown Gate, close to Union Square and in the middle of fabulous restaurants. The Orchard Garden has a nice restaurant with very good food, also. The rooms aren't huge, but they are new and large enough for two people. The bathrooms are very nice. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SShahin
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a few doors down from Chinatown entrance and a short walk to Union Square. Nice and quiet rooms, very comfortable beds, nice furniture and appliances. Tea/coffee maker included. Staff was very friendly and relaxed. Great price for what you're getting! Would return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gailm
Reviews.Content: We liked the Orchard Garden a lot and thought it was a great value in the city. Stayed at the Orchard, their sister hotel, a few years ago and liked it also but I think we like the OG better - location seemed more convenient. BART station & Market St transportation an easy walk away. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful - in fact outstanding. The room was comfortable and everything was spotless. They sold out of the room category we booked and gave us a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The suite wasn't overly large but did have a nice sitting area - so not sure what the size of standard rooms are. The rooftop garden looked quite pleasant and they encourage people to visit it and take a drink or food up there if they wish to. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was okay but not outstanding. We had drinks in the bar during happy hour and complimentary appetizers which were actually quite tasty. The drinks are expensive but with the appetizers, overall it was fine - we were interested in a light dinner and as it turned out we didn't need to go out anywhere to eat after that. All in all, we were very glad that we stayed here and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Fruitful stay at the Orchard Gardne”
Reviews.Author: Stephers
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden did look as good as the photos on it's website!! Sometimes you arrive and the hotel looks completely different from what you thought you had booked. The rooms were clean and tidy, very spacious, I liked the quirky sliding doors for the bathrooms, which as the room was spacious too. The view from the room was of the building next door, but as I booked the hotel early through Expedia at a discounted rate, that is probably why. This didn't bother us as we were more interested in getting out and about in San Francisco. I also liked the green approach that the hotel had, there were different sections in the bin for paper and plastics, we always recycle at home, why not when on holiday. The staff were all very friendly, greeting you as you came and left the hotel, offering maps and advice on what to see and getting around. There is free wi-fi, which was available in the lobby area. We visited the roof garden but it was getting quite late at night so didn't stay up there too long. The location is great, on the doorstep from China Town and only a few blocks from Union square and the main shopping area. It is a bit of a trek to the Fisherman's Wharf area, if you don't fancy the walk, you can get a muni pass that allows you to use the old fashioned trams (which is a must) and the buses that are frequent but do get busy. The main reason I booked this hotel was from the other reviews I read on this website. Thanks TripAdvisor for good honest advice

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: imasianplum
Reviews.Content: I wasn't overly impressed with the Orchard Garden Hotel. They are at a good location and I think it's great that they are all about GREEN. To save energy, the room lights only turn on when you put your room key card in a slot - cool idea. They have recyling bins in the room. I didn't like the bathroom sliding door. It wasn't a door that sealed shut (it's like a panel that slides in front of the open space where a door would be) so it didn't feel completely private. One of the front desk guys was not particularly friendly. The "business center" was a very small room with 2 computers and a printer that didn't print. The lobby has 2 small couches and not a lot of space to hang out. Ice machines are on every other floor and no signs pointing you to where they are so I had to roam the halls. My mom was in another room and had a couple of items taken (face cremes) when the room was cleaned. This place was no big deal and somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find in great location!”
Reviews.Author: spwinaz
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden is a great eco-friendly hotel! I spent four nights there at the end of august for a relaxing getaway. We had the basic standard room which was a little small and not the best view in the world but everything else about the hotel made up for it! The bed was spectacularly comfortable and the staff was more than willing to help us with any questions we had. The rooftop terrace was great and had an amazing view of the city. We took the BART in from the airport and walked a few blocks to the hotel which was easy to find. Perfect location near Union Square and right next to Chinatown. We either walked everywhere or took the cable car to the Fisherman's Warf. The tour we went on to Napa and Sonoma Valley was great and they picked us up from the hotel. The restaurant 'Roots' has an organic selection of food that was great and the bar's happy hour was great as well! I read about the French cafe across the street on Trip Advisor and gave it a try-it was nice to sit outside and poeple watch. I will definately stay there again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Worth checking out....... very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: WestVanMan
Reviews.Content: We four, parents and two older teens enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel recently. Two attractions led us there. One, we stayed at the Orchard Hotel up the street, which is it's 'parent hotel', several years ago which was rated #1 at the time on tripadvisor and two, the Orchard Garden claimed to be the first 'green' hotel in California. For me, that counts and being an architect, I was curious to find out how this was achieved. Also, with the popularity of the Orchard and the time that has passed since we were last there, the rates at the Orchard were somewhat higher than at this new hotel. First, the location. It's close to the parent hotel, being on Bush St. and literally two doors down from the Chinatown Gate on Grant. That puts the hotel about 2 1/2 blocks from Union Square. Having stayed at a few hotels in the area, I would have to say this is a particularly good location as it is quiet being away from the tourist madness and cable cars of Powell St. yet close enough to find good places to eat and of course shop. Plus the street front itself is not congested with tourists. The hotel itself is quite tastefully done with interiors designed in a contemporary style with light coloured wood panelling and flooring. It was very clean throughout. The Ground Floor has the reception area, business centre (two computers), a small windowless exercise room with 3 machines, elevator lobby (2 elevators), but is largely occupied by the Roots restaurant which is also where the complimentary breakfast buffet is served (more on that later). We arrived early and staff were more than happy to check our luggage and called us when the room was ready. They provide to the room the SF Chronicle and at the front desk, the Wall St. Journal. We landed the top, 10th floor with a view down to Grant Street and adjacent towers, but not much else. The room however was very nice, but not large by any means. Again in light coloured finishes, there was a useful, long built-in shelf along the flat screen TV wall which also incorporated several drawers and the mini bar. The TV selection also included high def channels. Internet connection is wireless and free. There were two queen beds with nice bedding and appointments. There was also enough room for an armchair. The bathroom was quite nice, using a space saving sliding door, and was adequately lit. Toiletries included Aveda shampoo and Thymes conditioners and lotions which come in biodegradeable containers. Towels were nice cotton towels, but I thought should have been bamboo if "green" was the intent. All in all, a very comfortable room, but maybe not quite as well appointed as the rooms in it's parent, the Orchard Hotel. The 'green' aspects of the hotel don't jump out at you and perhaps that's how it should be. However other than sourcing building materials from the region, using some recycled materials and minimizing landfill debris, there are few unique aspects of the hotel that make it green. It's no Federal Building, a new very green building near Civic Centre, but then hotels don't really lend themselves well to being truely green without spending alot of money on which it would be very difficult to realize a profitable return. And as it turns out, on the LEED scale of rating green buildings, it just barely qualifies. Finally, the complimentary breakfast. Nothing to write home about and perhaps for me the least impressive/most disappointing 'feature' of the hotel. While the fare was certainly adequate, the choice, variety and inventiveness was quite pedestrian, especially given the effort made to make this a sustainable hotel I would have expected the breakfast to be more interesting. There's the regular juices and coffee. One selection of cold cut (ham) and sliced cheese, some fresh fruit, usually watermelon and cantaloupe, baked goods like bagels, sliced bread, small muffins and I think small croissants, although they were akin to those you might find in a supermarket. Cereal and hard boiled eggs pretty much rounded it out. The plates provided were rather small, perhaps limiting the take one might have. It was pretty much the same every day during our 4 days there. We did not have dinner here. Perhaps I'm dwelling too much on the breakfast and it is certainly not a deal breaker for this hotel. We had a very enjoyable stay here and would definitely recommend anyone to seriously consider the Orchard Garden. We would definitely come back here, but not because it's 'green'.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Squads
Reviews.Content: I thought this was an above average hotel in a fantastic location. Room: Modern, clean, very comfortable and quiet rooms. They are slightly small but this is typical for hotels I have stayed in in SF. The discreet in-room recycling bins were a nice touch. Hotel Facilities: Not much. There is a very small fitness room and 'business centre'. We didn't use the restaurant - there are excellent dinning options very near by. The staff were helpful. Location: Great location near Union Square and Chinatown. SF is a very easy city to explore - tip: buy a MUNI pass and use it hop on and off the regular busses and the cable cars, too!

Reviews.Title: “Not as "WOW" as I expected”
Reviews.Author: wilbo-wanderer
Reviews.Content: Ok - so I had just traveled rom the UK, driven from the airport and was tired. From previous reviews I was expecting to be blown away but It was OK. Room was abit on the small side, recptio area uninspiring and staff a little distant. Views fro shared balcony disappointing. Location great for Chinatown. Dining area empty early evening so uninviting. Not sure about the green credentials - did not seem much better than your average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: NickyLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Ideal place for stay with 2 teenagers -after 3 weeks touring it was good to sink into the room comforts of the Orchard. It is in walking distance of shops,good places to eat and site seeing.We all found the area safe to be in and loved being so near to the bustle of the city centre,trams and China Town. Great to return to the peace of the hotel . It lived up to expectations and was exactly as described. My two appreciated free online access and the gym. I would have appreciated some snack/drink complimentaries for them along with the tea/coffee rather than keeping them away from the mini bar priced goodies! (They had enjoyed a great menu of complimentaries during our stay at hotel in Hollywood and felt this would have put the Orchard up in their rating of the top city places we had stayed -as such it took second place!) Front of line staff always willing and helpful. Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Anne5757
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Orchard Garden. Classy hotel, lovely room. Extremely convenient location. Staff are wonderful, very efficient and helpful. Offered lots of tips about places to visit - in San Francisco and nearby. Can't comment re the food as we didn't eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Darnie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent at booking in guaranteeing adjoining rooms for us and our children. Everywhere else we had been on our two week road trip we were simply offered "best efforts" which really doesn't suffice with three children. We found the hotel well located for our requirements. Walking is easy (once you get used to the hills!) and taxis were well priced. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. There are DVD players in the rooms and a small library at the Front Desk so it was good to watch "Escape from Alcatraz" with the children! The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. If you use the valet parking it's quite expensive and it took about 30 minutes for our car to arrive when we left - so you may find it better to abandon your car before you come into the City. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel - it looked pleasant enough but we chose to take in variety elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: enzopdoodle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our two-night stay at the Orchard Garden. Our room was large and quiet. All the amenities were perfect, and we liked the fact that it was a green hotel. The breakfast was a special treat. Billed as a European-style breakfast, it includes cereals, breads, fruits, meats, cheeses, and hard-boiled eggs--just what we needed to start our day. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Go Green”
Reviews.Author: Desert_Lizard
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, "green" hotel in a great location, this is the place for you. It is right around the corner from China Town and a short walk from Union Square. The beds were so comfortable, I did not want to get up in the morning. If you need ice, check the 7th floor in a closet. =) I found out the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: ababychicken
Reviews.Content: Spacious and Quiet! I was in SF for business and was relieved to have such a pleasant place to rest my head. I had a room facing Bush st. and never heard any noise for the 6 nites I was there. The mattress is amazingly comfortable. The fact that this is a eco-friendly hotel makes high marks too. The location is great for exploring Chinatown. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The only suggestion I would have for them is to offer more TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ptarantino
Reviews.Content: Good value in San Francisco.We enjoyed our four night stay at the Orchard Garden, it's one of the first "green" hotels in the United States. The room was spacious, clean and quiet, even though our room was on the second floor facing the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located near the Chinatown Gate and within a few blocks from Union Square and the Cable Car line which provides transportation to nearly all tourist venues.If possible, leave your car at home, otherwise plan on spending $50 or more on parking per day.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Garden Hotel, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Jal_lead
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel, San Francisco from 12 - 15th July 2008. We found the hotel to be excellent. The service was great, the hotel was very clean, very quiet and had free internet access in their business centre. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the staff were all very polite. The hotel, built in 2006, is the first hotel in America to use the room key to turn on the electricity in the room therefore saving electricity when you leave the room because you take the room key with you! We found this a bit funny because we've been using this technology in Australia for at least 25 years. It is just at the bottom of China Town and very close to the trolley cars, but it is also only a few blocks from the centre of town where you could catch all different types of public transport. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant beacause there were so many other places to eat, so can't comment on their food.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: FrancesIsrael
Reviews.Content: Really nice, smallish hotel in great location right near China Town gate! Nice rooms, very clean, modern bright decor. Very friendly & helpful staff. Added bonus - ecologically friendly, a real green hotel!! Frances, Israel

Reviews.Title: “WOW! A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Hailes family
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orchard Garden, Bush Street, for two nights in July 2008. Following comments from some Trip Advisor members, we requested high rooms at back of hotel to avoid street noise. The hotel allocated 1001 and 1002 which are the highest and rearmost rooms available. These were amazingly quiet! The rooms were very high quality and matched our requirements exactly. This was the only hotel out of six in North America that let us re-use our towels (many hotels have signs in the bathrooms that suggest you should re-use the towels to save the environment - this was the only one that didn't change the towels even though we hung them on the towel rail in every hotel expecting to reuse them). We used the hotel restaurant for breakfasts and were pleasantly surprised by quality of breakfast. Hotel is a resonably easy walk up from BART Montgomery Street station, so transfer to/from airport was comparatively easy using public transport. I walked to the tourist trap areas of Cannery Row and Pier 39 in 20 minutes from the hotel; Market Street is about 5 minutes. Would I stay again - yes!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable stay - ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Atraveller46
Reviews.Content: Chose the Orchard Garden (after reading reviews on Trip Advisor) for a recent trip to SF. Excellent location, no road noise (we were on the ninth floor) and although the view wasn't great we were impressed with the cleanliness, helpful staff and reasonable breakfast. The Alamo / national car rental garage is easily within walking distance on Bush St. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends / family. Also recommend Sears for food! (just off Union Square)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: Veru nice hotel and well located. People were very friendly and helpful. Price is very reasonnable knowing it is down town San Francisco. I would recommend staying in this place, plus it is also environmental friendly. A Drink at the terrasse is also much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - the best!”
Reviews.Author: dgreener
Reviews.Content: Clean, beautiful, classy. In San Francisco, a great deal too. We paid $204 per night (AAA) excluding tax, for a room with 2 double beds. Non-smoking, eco-friendly, CLEAN, small rooms (but typical size for the city). We had a 2nd floor room on the Bush Street side, and I cannot believe how quiet it was - almost weird how sound-proof the windows were. Very comfortable beds too. Be sure to grab Starbucks (across the street, on both corners) and take it to the roof-top garden in the morning. Visit the bar in the hotel restaurant (Roots) and have a fantastic free appetizer (garlic fries) during happy hour (4:30-7:00 p.m.). Avoid the pseudo-french cafe directly across the street though - $$$, so-so food, and poor service. Close to Chinatown, Union Square, North Beach, cable cars, BART, Embarcadero, etc. We ate in North Beach every night (walked) and had outstanding meals (try Franchino's) and really great gelato. The walk to North Beach from the Orchard is about 15-20 minutes (Bush to Kearney to Columbus) or about a $5 cab fare. Recommend the evening tour of Alcatraz too - even if you've been on the standard day tour, check out the evening version...special presentations, less crowded, city lights - it's awesome! HornBlower on Pier 33 is the only way to go ($30 per ticket) - and about $6 cab fare. Walk the Bay Area Ridge Trail through the Presidio (free). A great urban trail that winds through forested and historic sections of the park, and culminates with amazing ocean views from the battery bluffs, and a trip across the Golden Gate bridge. Total out-and-back round trip from the Arguello Gate, including across the bridge is about 8 miles, so plan on a 4 hour walk if your fit...and if you're not fit, go anyway. Cab fare from the Orchard to the Arguello Gate is about $8. The Orchard Garden staff is extremely polite, friendly, and helpful. If you need a cab, directions, or anything at all, they'll help. We're a very discerning family, and my travel goal is to find the cleanest places at the best prices - so I don't just throw praise around casually. You won't be disappointed here unless you want to stay where you smell churros from Pier 39 all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: likeshesaid
Reviews.Content: What a great find!!! We took our first trip to SF over spring break and loved the hotel. The staff is incredibly helpful, the rooms are small but very nice, and I love the idea of a "green" hotel. The rooms even have guides of environmentally friendly shops and restaurants along with recycling bins. Its also in a great location as its right next to Chinatown and a 5-10 min walk to a ton of great restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in SF”
Reviews.Author: Nitsan
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel and it was excellent. The staff is friendly, the rooms are well decorated and the location is fabulous - right next to Chinatown and Union square. Two small things that can be improved: 1. There was not enough storage space in our room so most of our stuff had to remain in our luggage. 2. There are not enough towel hangers in our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YankeeFan61
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. Close to Union Square, Chinatown, trolley cars. Staff is top notch. Rooms were tastefully appointed (nice having an iPod dock) and a large bathroom! Look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travel1910
Reviews.Content: My niece and I shared a great corner room at the Orchard Garden Hotel for four nights. The room was spacious, clean and had great comfortable beds! We really enjoyed the spa-like feel - it was a joy to come back to our room at the end of our busy day. Perfect location for sightseeing, shopping, and dining - close to Union Square, next door to China Town gates, easy to grab public transportation. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We enjoyed dining at the french bistro across the street - Cafe de la Presse. Impressed by the hotel's "green' policies and practices. Also, I booked a great rate - felt like I really got more than my money's worth. The rooftop terrace is nice - but the weather was a little too chilly! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: colaprete
Reviews.Content: We just returned from from our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel in San Francisco. The hotel is in a great location, in walking distance to everything. The hotel was very clean (felt like brand new), very quiet, the beds were very comfortable with down comforters and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely return. We also liked the French cafe across the street for breakfast or for the afternoon snack.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FlowOz
Reviews.Content: Apart from the check-in mix up (we were sent to the wrong room - someone was still staying there!), we had a wonderful time! The hotel was located close to Union Square (it was closer the Orchard Hotel). The staff was polite, helpful and wonderful (they even let us borrowed their staff microwave). Not to mention they provided free internet service (they got WiFi too but bringing a laptop to the States was such a hassle). The room was clean and tidy. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: dskuh
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel was perfect for our stay (just two of us - getaway from the kids for a weekend.) The location was great - gateway to Chinatown, walking distance to Embarcadero and Ferry Building, SOMA and Union Square. Cafe De La Presse right across the street for nice breakfast and the best lattes. Rooms were small, but wonderfully clean and neat. Bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom, but it was nice to have a separate shower and bathtub (we stayed in a Jr. Suite.) It was nice to see they had trash & paper recycling. Bed was very comfortable with crisp, white sheets. All the staff we talked to were pleasant and professional. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goonie3323
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The staff was so accommodating and friendly, no matter how small the request. The beds were HEAVEN, and the linens divine. The breakfast buffet served downstairs in the morning was very good too. And we never heard anything from any other rooms near us. Very quiet once you're in your room. And make sure to check out the roof top area. It offers a great view of the city and is a romantic place to hang out with a bottle of wine. The location was great - very central to all the 'tourist sites'. The entrance to China Town is literally around the corner where there are a few really good Chinese food restaurants to eat. Yum. There also was a GREAT bar across the street called "The Irish Bank Bar" on Mark Lane. The music was great and the drinks were killer. So if you're looking for a relaxed place to have a drink or two, you have to check that place out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel; great location and price”
Reviews.Author: ntguru911
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a safe and convenient location in SF. The cable car lines are only a couple blocks' walk. The hotel itself is quite new and all the rooms are bright and airy. The hotel staff is pleasant and the price is right on Priceline (under $200 with name your own price). Bathroom is excellent. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo71
Reviews.Content: The Orchard hotel has a great location right next to the China Town gate, yet out room was very quiet. The bed was the best we have ever experienced in a hotel and the facitilies in our room cover all you would need for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: c-dizzle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently and absolutely loved everything about this hotel. The location is fantastic. It is within walking distance of Union Square, cablecars, Embarcadero and Chinatown is virtually at the doorstep. The beds are extremely comfortable. The best bed I have experienced in a hotel. I loved the decor and the colours used in the rooms it is contemporary but also very homely. We enjoyed coming back to our room every night! The room was very quiet, no city noise at all, we were on a high floor. Free wireless internet was great. We used this a lot. Turndown service a nice touch. Service at the hotel was everything I would have expected. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good value hotel in a good location in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKz
Reviews.Content: This "green" hotel is beautiful. It is located in an area that is charming (Chinatown) and is close to transportation. We travel quite a bit and would give this hotel the best rating, would stay there again, and will tell others about it.

Reviews.Title: “i don't recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Clara58
Reviews.Content: My room was extremely noisy... not unexpected for a city hotel but I could actually hear conversations of people passing by or standing in front of the hotel. The hotel is lovely, clean and the staff are friendly but if you can't sleep it's very difficult to recommend a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer for sure--outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: greengirl345
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED this hotel!! And we'll plan to stay again and let our friends know about the Orchard Garden. +First, it's GREEN and LEED certified +The rooms were spacious +Bed was comfortable +Hotel is quiet, but in a GREAT location! +Garden deck on top is fun for a private cocktail! +Wireless internet was free and easy to use +Complimentary coffee in the lobby was a plus! +Passes to 24-hour fitness 3 blocks away was great -Parking was expensive at $38/day, and it took about 30 minutes for them to retrieve our car (they use a 3rd party for that).

Reviews.Title: “It was our Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: earlyriser75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. Everything about it was perfect! Ross checked us in with a friendly smile and with great enthusiasm. The room was larger than we expected. It had a king bed, desk with chair and dresser. The bathroom was huge! The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Probably one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in away from home. The extra touches were very appreciated such as morning news paper and turn down service. I also liked the fact that the alarm clock charged/played our ipod. We would definately stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel0510
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful. It was clean and fresh and totally green. The location was perfect. The service was friendly. We would stay here again and again. It made our trip wonderful to have such a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lazarina
Reviews.Content: We had chosen the Orchard Garden Hotel based on the high number of positive reviews. We travelled with two children and were very comfortable in two adjoining rooms on the 8th floor, with one room being a suite. The beds were extremely comfortable, and there was a long desk with mini bar, and a good shower/bath in the bathroom. We found it inconvenient that the bathroom had nowhere to keep a toiletry kit, except by the sink. A shelf or small table would have helped. The breakfast was included and was a basic buffet with juices, a fruit basket, a bread basket , boiled eggs and olives! The location was terrific for Union Square and its shopping, as well as for downtown Embarcadero. Overall we were happy to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in the City, with minor suggestions”
Reviews.Author: David063
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden is terrific hotel in a fantastic location. Walking distance to the top of Nob Hill, while also an easy walk to the Ferry Building. Nice people, excellent service. Very comfortable beds and quiet, spacious room. Reasonable price under $200 over the weekend, too. I didn't visit the restaurant, nor use the fitness equipment. Spent time in the city instead. I would only recommend one thing: the rooftop terrace could benefit from some improvement. In my opinion, if you do a rooftop space, it should make guests feel comfortable and be an oasis within the city. See Hotel Vitale in SF or Hotel Giraffe in NY. Great rooftops. When we visited the Orchard Garden's rooftop at night, the lighting didn't work. It also didn't have much landscaping and wasn't very inviting overall. It didn't even really fit with the the atmosphere for the rest of the hotel. But, I really like this hotel overall and it will get my first call for my next visit. Everything else was great and price and location are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great HQ for SF visit”
Reviews.Author: steve_randomno
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with partner for mixture of business and leisure. Main things we liked were: -decor - this hotel is brand new, the building the decor, everything -room - plasma TV, great marble style bathroom, eficient and quiet aircon, light and airy room -helpful and friendly staff We probably had the smallest room in the hotel (based on the plans on the back of the door) it would have been nice to have had a larger room but it wasn't enough of an issue to ask to be moved. Thus the size of the most rooms must be quite large (estimated at 350-400 sqft). There is a nice patio area on the top floor with some good views of the city. Free wireless. An encounter that illustrates the helpful service at this hotel: On our last night we fancied going out for a burger. It had to be a burger, nothing else would do! It was quite late and we spotted whom we assumed to be the bar manager having a chat to one of his collegues outside the front of the hotel. We asked about the best place to get a burger considering it was quite late. His sugestions were useful. However given that it was getting on he offered to rustle up a good burger for us in the hotel restaurant if we did not want to chance being too late. This was nice as the hotel restaurant is not realy aimed at the quick burger and fries market! Nevertheless, we had an extreemly nice burger and a glass of wine in the elegant surroundings of the hotel restaurant and with excellent and helpfull service. It is little things like that that make me want to return. A case study in good customer service. The location is probably the best base for exploring the city. See my other review of the older sister hotel, The Orchard, a couple of blocks away. If you want a great value,high quality hotel in the heart of SF, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden”
Reviews.Author: sparks5311
Reviews.Content: The staff was really nice and helpfull. The hotel was really clean and very comfortable. We had dinner at Roots and really loved it. We highly recommend the Steak dinner, it was delicious! The location was great, however, the parking was a little hectic and pricey there. We would stay there again, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: norcal-roadtripper
Reviews.Content: Everything went without a hitch from the moment we pulled up to the valet to the moment we said goodbye to the valet. I am particularly impressed that this is a "Green" hotel and lives up to it's philosophy and standards. The room was lovely, serene, comfortable and quiet, and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful and available if needed. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows. There was a flat screened TV on the wall, a DVD player, a CD player, and lots of fun stuff to read. The bar was cozy and Darrin was fun and accommodating. Hotel is in a prime location. We had breakfast downstairs at Roots and the food was very good, as was the service. Don't miss the roof garden. You can take your coffee or drink up there and enjoy the views. Kudos to the entire staff. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “honest review”
Reviews.Author: Gooch26
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the end of march. after a long flight from ireland it was lovely to be greeted with a smile as we arrived and checked in. for the five days we where there the hotel staff where very helpfull but the where just really nice and friendly people. the room itself was interesting, americans make a big deal out of Green "key cards" this is common in europe and has been for years so im not going to get too excited about that. the best thing about the room was the bed! wow huge and very comfortable. the room is not big but its a city centre hotel they are never big. the down points where the bathroom. (1) a sliding door that dose not fully close. this really bugged me (2) the shower was terrible being green is fine but it still has to meet basic requirements and to be honest my girlfriend thought that she would have a better chance washing her hair in the rain. i think the big winner in this hotel is its location and its staff. you are close to everything and a short cab ride from fishermans warff. if i was to pick a hotel to stay in again i would have to consider somewhere else because a hotel is supposed to cover basic needs like showering which as silly as it might sound really got on our nerves .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Bed”
Reviews.Author: lashimo
Reviews.Content: The best bed I've ever been in - went all the way to San Francisco from Florida and just napped!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant City Hotel. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are compact but well organized with very comfortable beds and pillows, good lighting and adequate storage. There is a flat screen TV and free wireless connection in a spotless, modern setting. The bathrooms are well appointed with Aveda products. The water pressure seemed weak, perhaps to save water. The windows do not open which is a drawback when you just want fresh air. Although the AC/heating system worked well, it was very noisy. Also, avoid a room with an adjoining room door. The doors are not very soundproof, but the efficient staff moved us right away to a quieter room. We also prefer the rooms facing the street than some of the rooms that have the wall of another building as your view. The buffet breakfast was disappointing and boring. Better to get a rate without breakfast and eat elsewhere (french cafe across the street). Also, the gym is very small and claustrophobic. In many respects we prefer their sister hotel, but the hotel's LEED certification and emphasis on sustainability is very appealing. Hopefully, it will become the industry standard. Overall, the staff was very helpful and friendly making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Green credentials”
Reviews.Author: USAophile
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel that claims a range of green features, some of which seemed to be stretching the point somewhat. However it was a pleasant stay with particularly firendly and helpful staff. Minus points were the size of the bedroom (small); a sliding door on the bathroom that didn't have any pretence at privacy; high bar prices ($14 for a glass of wine) and exorbitant parking charges ($37 per day) when there were public facilities on the same block (for $24 a day.) Overall, good but not exceptional enough to make me want to go back. Darrin, the bar steward would make me want to go back though, just for the entertainment value. He was a scream!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: casBoulder
Reviews.Content: Quite green. For example room key card put near door inside room turns on and off the electrial equipment in the room, automatic turn down of thermostat upon leaving the room. Comfortable beds, high-quality towels and bedding, good well-located, good European breakfast was included for us, generally very efficient and warm service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kckaye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel. We were pleasantly suprised at the quality of the services provided at the hotel. We did not rent a car for our stay in San Fran, so we cannot comment on the parking rates. The location was close to the BART Montgomery station. Just a few blocks away and close enough to walk to. The staff are very friendly. The greeted us every morning when we left and every evening when we returned to the hotel. They were also very helpful in providing maps, directions, and assistance when asked. Always with a smile on their faces. The room itself was cozy. Not small. It was enough room for my husband and myself. We also requested to be away from the noise and got a room that didn't have that great of a view, but since we didn't plan on staying in the hotel room for htat long, this did not matter much to us at all. The bathroom was a nice size as well. One thing that both my husband and I were really impressed with was the hotel's move to being "green". My husband has a knack for forgetting to turn off lights as he leaves a room, so the 'lightswitch' that can only be activated by hotel key was a nice touch. This comes in really handy for two reasons: it helps conserve energy by being able to control all the lights with one switch, but it also helps you to always remember where your room key is, and allows you to 'turn off' your lights as you leave the room for the day. <-- GREAT FEATURE My husband and I were not impressed with the prices of the minibar, but they are usually always expensive. We also didn't use the the room service or restaurant, again fo rthe prices. We had Subway Sandwiches form across the street because they were selling footlong sandwiches for 5 dollars. So it is hard to compete with that. But hotel prices for food are also usally high to begin with. Overall, we enjoyed this hotel. We would definately stay there again when we come back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Stay"”
Reviews.Author: humejon
Reviews.Content: The whole process was very simple from start to finish. Starting with an easy check in and up to room 707 (king w/ a view of Bush St). The room is decorated very cleanm and tasteful. Everything felt very clean. This is the main ingredient for me when looking for a hotel; clean and comfortable. Overall the stay was great, except one thing that frustrated me on the last night my girlfriend and i were there. We wanted to go to dinner in the mission on a date before we met up with friends and when i asked the Conceirge where he would suggest he looked at me like I had five heads (most upper scale hotels are spot on when it comes to suggesting restaurants). I explained that a freind suggested Foreign Cinema and Quince but i had tried to make a reservation at both places but they were booked. The man just stared at me and stuttered i asked do you know of anything similar that i might try. He had nothing for me so i asked for a map and he hesiatated for a second like he didnt understand. SO i grabbed a map and luckiliy they had a business center and i booked a reservation via open table at Garcon. Which by the way is quite a quality meal. Other than this little blip we were quite satisfied and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, staff, and room!”
Reviews.Author: travelisfun2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated and spacious. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. They provided great restaurant suggestions and travel directions. We also enjoyed the roof top terrace for its views of the city. This hotel is much more energy conscious than other hotels we have stayed at. They take care of their property and the impact that they have on the environment. They offer recycling in the rooms and have energy efficient technology to regulate how much electricity you are using in your room. It may not be 100% organic and green in every single aspect but it came pretty close. Upon speaking to the staff about the hotel, it is apparent that there is great effort taken to be sustainable. It is way ahead of most hotels and it is a LEED building. We greatly enjoyed our stay here because of the great service and the great location. This hotel is a brief 5-10 minute walk to all the shopping near Union Square and it is close to the financial district. We didn't use it, but the hotel offers complimentary town car service to the financial district. It was also a 10 minute walk to the BART station (Montgomery St. Station). The hotel was excellent and we will be staying here again next time we visit in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: genie-miami
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended and we were looking forward to staying in a beautiful green hotel. Upon our arrival, we were quite favorably impressed with the room. Our room was actually large for San Francisco, and it was quite clean and lovely. The first thing that distressed me about the hotel was the fact that other than one Clif bar, I found that none of the mini-bar snacks were organic. We have stayed in green hotels and inns all around the US and Europe, and this lack of organic food was a big surprise to me. The hotel's restaurant also says nothing about organic foods on its menu, although they note that they use sustainable fish and hormone-free meats. We did eat dinner with them anyway and the food was quite delicious, but I was disappointed that it wasn't what I consider really "green." Now here comes the bad part. When we checked out (after a one night stay) we found out that the parking for one night was $38.00 + $5.32 tax. I live in a city that has very high parking fees, but this seemed excessive. Whatever -- it's just play money on vacation anyway. But we found out, after arriving at the airport, they gave us the wrong car!!!!!!! Another guest had rented an identical car and they gave us his. Our car was still sitting there with a $2000 painting in the back. I called the hotel and spoke to a young man there who seemed to try and put the blame on me (didn't you notice it was the wrong car?). He never apologized, and asked me how I wanted to pay for the shipping of my painting. What? I said I didn't think I should have to pay -- so they shipped it at their cost, but it came damaged because it was packed so carelessly. He told me the manager would call me to let me know that everything was taken care of, but, of course, I never got a call back. There's more. A few days later, I found a charge for over $100 on our credit card. My husband called the hotel and they said they had no record of this charge, but agreed it was incorrect. The charge was supposed to be $43.32 for the (overpriced) parking, and the operations manager said they would refund us the parking fee (since they gave us the wrong car!!). Big mix up. Today I checked the card to make sure they had given us the refund. Oh my. They not only didn't refund us that %100+, they charged us another parking fee! Gee whiz, now they are just dipping into our funds any time they feel like it! So the hotel isn't really so green, they won't apologize to you if something goes wrong, and you should be very wary of giving them your credit card, but otherwise it's very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlc319
Reviews.Content: One of the best and most clean hotels I have ever stayed in. The hotel staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. The location was good, just next to the Chinatown gates. The hotel room was a bit small but managed to enjoy it. The bathroom was so clean and by far the best hotel bathroom I have ever seen. The business center was a nice touch and the fitness room was really small. The doorman was always willing to grab a cab for you with the help of his whistle. There was also fresh fruit out on the front desk so it was nice to walk by and grab something on the go. A local pizza place up two blocks Uncle Vitos was a nice place to enjoy some pizza. Another nice place to eat was called the Stinking Rose. Great food for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BarryMoses
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right on the edge of Chinatown with Union Square and Columbus Avenue both within easy walking distance. We didn't try the food always went out - plenty of restaurants (breakfast cafes) within easy walking distance. Rooms are small but well equipped - the bathroom was as big as the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl3700
Reviews.Content: Referred to this hotel by a business colleague. The rates were great for the location, so I booked it. I was incredibly impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and all of the convienences offered. Will definately stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Orchard Garden”
Reviews.Author: meli55a
Reviews.Content: If you're a business person looking for a hotel either for a short or long stay, then you must check out the Orchard Garden Hotel. I came to San Francisco for a work conference for a few days and enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The rooms are spacious, beds are so comfortable, very clean hotel/room and the staff are very helpful!! The location is great too - right near the entry gate of Chinatown, a short work to Union Square and cable cars. It's also a small cab fare to anywhere. Would definitely stay here again if Iâ€™m back in town!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastJaneDoe08
Reviews.Content: What a treat to have stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel. I had to pick a hotel with my business picking up the tab and I'm quite pleased I chose this hotel! Upon arrival, we were promptly greeted and our bags stowed since our room was yet to be ready. We got back in our car and when we returned several hours later our room was waiting and they remembered us so they handed us the keys and bags w/o even asking us again. Valet service was exceptional! Never had to wait long for our car, nor worry about the rental car being parked. It was worth the $37 for 24 hours! We went back and forth quite a lot and no complaints from the staff. The room was comfortable and the bed was AMAZING! The bathroom was nice accomodated with nice ammenities. I don't know if what was provided were Aveda products, but nonetheless they were fine. Great bathrobes, and plenty of shower space. We checked out a DVD from the front desk (small selection but something for everyone) and also used the iPod clock to listen to tunes. The room was always cleaned and enough towels were provided. We were quite pleased with the cleaning staff! We also liked that the hotel recycled all our bottles and newspapers. Location was excellent. Short walk to BART, restaurants (Starbucks, Subway, and a lil' coffee shop across the street with the BEST hot chocolate!). The front desk was quick to show us the most cost effective route to the wharf, restaurants, etc. We never got lost and I commend the front desk for giving us directions. My only downside is you shouldn't have to pay $250+ for the room, it's more like $200 or less, but that's because you can always find a good rate out there! Internet was a little slow, but not a big deal! If you're looking for a great stay then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the Entrance to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: freesias
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better hotel experiences I've had. The beds are extremely comfortable and the hotel is in immaculate condition. Super quiet even though it is in the middle of a bustling city. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The hotel staff are very helpful and service is friendly and quick, especially the front desk. Bed turnover service is available and you can come home to a clean room with chocolate next to your bed. We ordered in from the room service menu (I believe from the restaurant in the hotel next to the front desk) and the food is pricey as expected but wasn't anything special. Overall, great hotel to stay at and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: DancerPa
Reviews.Content: I have have experienced two exceptional stays at the Orchard Garden and recommend it highly. It is truly an "oasis" for the business traveler, offering a high level of service and beautiful accommodations. The staff is very helpful and friendly, making it even more of a pleasure. The fact that it is also a "green" hotel makes staying there even more of a priority for me.

Reviews.Title: “The little things count!”
Reviews.Author: chic_traveler_8
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped my travel-weary body into the this hotel, I was instantly rejuvinated. My shuttle door was opened for me and my luggage brought inside where I was quickly checked into my room. Throughout my stay I was greeted by all employees and no request was too outlandish. Complimenty newspaper outside your door, great Aveda products, a selection of dvd's to watch on the flatscreen tv and a luxurious bath made it difficult for me to leave the room for sightseeing! The bed was extremely comfortable and their bathrobes are worth buying so you can have a little luxury at home. Location-wise, this hotel is an relaxing 10 minute walk to Union Sqaure and right next door to the China Gate. Cabs are easy to come by and there is a valet service available if you have a car. The room-service breakfast was delicious but if you would like some atmosphere there is a lovely french-style cafe across the road. Starbucks is one block over and a lovely sushi bar just down the way. There are a fair amount of homeless people in this part of town but I never felt unsafe - even when walking by myself at night. When my shuttle service did not arrive in time to take me to the airport, the lovely concierge offered up their towncar at no extra charge. I look forward to my next stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A San Francisco Treat”
Reviews.Author: agnone
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orchard Garden was wonderful. My husband an d I are from Northeast Ohio and booked the hotel after surfing the web and reading about it. We came in on a Friday evening and checked out Sunday morning. The hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The bed was great ...so comfortable and the room perfect. We did not have a view as we booked with AAA and that is generally an interior room. Others had mentioned small rooms in their reviews but the size of the room was not an issue for us. It was just fine for a couple spending a weekend in San Francisco. The colors were calm and soothing as was the DVD for a relaxing nights sleep. The staff was very accomodating, particularly a young man named Davis, who certainly went out of his way for us and the other couple we were traveling with. The location could not have been better just steps away from Chinatown , a two block walk to the cable cars and the trolleys and streetcars. also there were cabs at the hotel doorstep at any time .You are also just a few blocks from the italian North Beach neighborhood and the other way is Union Square.. There are several good restaurants just down the street. .Sunday morning my husband and I went to Mass and had our choice of where to attend as there are two beautiful Catholic churches within a two minute walk As for dress - in the winter it is dressy casual...lots of layers , gloves scarf and jacket , maybe a dressier coat for evening. But on the whole S. F. and the Orchard Garden is pretty casual. We will definitely stay here again, there is so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “A great value that can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl808
Reviews.Content: This wonderful boutique hotel is in a great location just steps from Union Square and Chinatown. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was tastefully appointed and comfortable. I loved the Aveda bath products, California King size bed, cozy comforter, and perfectly-weighted robes. The free internet access and DVDs were added bonuses. I also appreciated the recyling containers in the room and the free newspaper delivered to your door in the morning. Finally, not only was the price good, but you get great value for your money. After such a fantastic experience it would take a lot to convince me to stay anywhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: annetw
Reviews.Content: I spent several nights and found the hotel comfortable, pleasant and well priced for a good location. The beds were super-comfortable. I actually slept through the night - amazing for a 28 week pregnant woman who tosses and turns trying to find a comfortable position. Only two minor complaints. Since I had a multiple night stay, I would have liked a little more variety, day to day, in the breakfast buffet. And, the elevators were ridiculously cold. But all in all, thumb's up. I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: vinylrules
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel was simply superb! What a gem. A truly beautiful hotel with an European flair, a super friendly staff, and at a great location to boot! The room was pure heaven with a super comfortable bed and a stunning bathroom. Loved the cushiony robes too! In fact, We meant to buy a set. The only word of warning would be that the rooms are rather small - some more than others - so be sure to ask to see the room in case you wish an upgrade. Since this was my wife's first time in San Francisco I did request a bigger room, also with a much better view -- and to our amazement, Jim, the manager at the time, made sure we were not charged for the upgrade! How great is that? Thanks Jim! (I hope this doesn't get you in trouble). All in all, a super delightful experience at the Orchard Garden Hotel. Needless to say...WAY highly recommended! (Pics to come)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: viajera725
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and friendly staff. The hotel is right near the gates of Chinatown and a couple of blocks from the shopping at Market Street. I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in SF. The big breakfast and environmental consciousness were a plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mushy-47
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. It is in a perfect location, but that is not the best thing about this hotel. It is beautiful, the staff is amazing, the appointments and furnishings are lovely, the Leed Certification is the way of the future and all for an unbelievable value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: allisonandjeff
Reviews.Content: Super all around! This hotel is located at the gates to Chinatown and walking distance to great shopping in Union Square and the cable car line to Fisherman's Wharf. As you would expect in SF, small rooms that work for 1-2 adults and a baby in a crib (we brought our son with us.) His portacrib fit in the bathroom. Nice flatscreen HD Tv's, comfortable beds, Aveda toiletries. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: Wow is all I can say! This was my 3rd visit here, and it just keeps getting better with each visit. The rooms are great, the amenities are nice, the Staff is incredible. The free breakfast was a treat. In the previous stays, I missed it due to my sleeping late. This time I made sure I went and ate. I love the fact the hotel is eco friendly! It was great to walk into China town, and be right there. It's very close to Union Square as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, eco-friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: fiftysomethingSue
Reviews.Content: For my first business trip to the city, I chose the environmentally friendly Orchard Garden, which was 3 blocks from my office away from home. The bed and breakfast package was a good value -- with fruit, cereals, baked goods, cheese and meats and hard boiled eggs available. Staff were very friendly, recommending a sushi restaurant 5 blocks away instead of the one across the street. Room was beautiful, clean, everything I expected of a business-class hotel. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel in SF!”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelBayArea
Reviews.Content: This a lovely gem....just a minutes walk into Chinatown or Union Square, this hotel is the best place we've ever stayed in SF. Small enough to maintain an intimate feel but without sacrificing any of the amenities. Light and bright, very clean, beautiful rooms, nice staff, good food and if all that's weren't enough, it's the first completely "green" hotel from the ground up. Though not inexpensive, for the value we found it worth every penny. We look forward to making this our permanent home base when visiting - for business or pleasure - San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Sharontrip
Reviews.Content: Great location. Cute boutique hotel. Park and Shop package, with buffet breakfast included, is an amazing value for SF.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ncginny
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice hotel very well run, hotel staff all very cordial and helpful. housekeeping also very polite and caring the room was inviting and bright - good lighting- perfect location downtown to everything, able to walk most everywhere. sheets and towels of good quality. a very good value for the price we paid. would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy”
Reviews.Author: lady_bec
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed (+), we liked that it is a green hotel. Nice tv. very cozy room, typical in san francisco. for the $, not sure you can't do as well or better. the location was great. also enjoyed the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Come Back”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelGurl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean and quiet and the location is great. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was due to the attitude of one staff person. When asking for directions, the front desk person told us to go use the business room and print them out ourselves. When we explained we were in a hurry, the person ignored us. Thankfully, another staff person came over and helped us out. However, this was a minor thing compared to the overall visit. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “A return to this hotel is definite!”
Reviews.Author: Ruebrezin
Reviews.Content: This new hotel on Bush Street, just around the corner from the gated entrance to Chinatown on Grant, is really well put-together. The hotel is 'green', having received the LEEDS certification. The rooms are small but functional and the beds are extremely comfortable and plush. One of the two elevators was out while we were here with no particular indication as to why or when it would be repaired, but we honestly didn't mind. The rate we got included breakfast and I will say that the breakfast was not that great and I wouldn't pay $14.00 for it if I didn't get it in my rate. The staff was efficient and friendly and non-intrusive. The rooftop garden was a nice place to sit and have a glass of wine with our friends before heading out for dinner. I would definitely come back to this hotel the next time a trip takes us to San Francisco. I would have no hesitation to recommend this hotel: GREAT LOCATION, VERY CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, JUST RIGHT!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Zusclare
Reviews.Content: While we loved the "green" aspect of this hotel, our stay was nothing special. The room was small, really too small for us. The hotel was also having some problems as result of a leak, so there was only one elevator working (and long waits for it) and the roof garden was not available. The hotel staff was very nice, but not particularly helpful. For example, when we needed a cab, they suggested we walk a few blocks to another street to find one. Another example, we wanted to go to the movies (it had been raining, we'd already enjoyed two museums) and we asked about nearby theaters; the theater names we were given were totally different from what was listed in the paper. Once we figured this out, it was too late to go to any of the movies we would have wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good impression”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan78
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at the Orchard Garden. The place is perfectly located a few blocks away from Union Square and Financial District, right next to Chinatown. The property is impeccably clean, and the overall green-yellow color scheme is as soothing as it is sophisticated. The personnel were generally very helpful with everything with the exception of a single minor maintenance request that has never been attended to, eve n despite an extra reminder. There is a tiny fitness room with just a couple of machines, a business center and a hugely overrated "roof garden" which is basically of no use because of cast iron furniture - try to seat in one of these chairs for two minutes in fall and have your butt frozen, or for a change have it roasted after two minutes in summer.
