My room 1005 - top floor king - was spacious and light. The bed, mattress and linens were wonderful and the two-layer bath robe - from a local company "Telegraph Hill" - was easily the best I had ever worn. The bathroom was quite large, with a full bath and vanity mirrors. There was a room safe, a tea/coffee maker, HDTV unit, DVD player and an ipod docking station (=alarm clock) in the room. The air conditioning unit was effective and not noisy at all. My reservation included a complimentary breakfast - unfortunately, the same selection five mornings in a row. Valet parking was $32 + tax. There are just two specific concerns that I would like to bring my fellow travelers' attention to as they may be quite annoying. Firstly, their room access cards deactivate each time you use them to access business center. You have to trot to the front desk to have your card reprogrammed after each visit to the business center. Another - and potentially quite embarrassing - concern is the sliding bathroom door. Not only can it not be locked from the inside, there is a 2 1/2-in gap around the whole door panel opening into the rest of the room. Bearing in mind how exciting all those bathroom sounds - and smells - can be, I strongly doubt this solution was correct... To summarize, apart from the two ridiculous flaws discussed above, this is a wonderful hotel, very much to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: longrider_7
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a conference and my wife found this hotel on the internet. The web site was very appealing and the location was within easy walking distance of the convention center. It was also located next to other active areas of the City including Chinatown and Union Square. But, what attracted us mostly to the hotel is that it is "green", constructed to the guidelines of the United States Green Building Council. So we booked the room. From the time of arrival to my departure, I was not disappointed. The design is modern and exceptionally clean. The staff (all the staff) was very helpful and friendly. My wife and I prefer smaller hotels over the large chains and the Orchard Garden fit perfectly into this perception. The room was exceptionally and tastefully furnished including a large, flat-screen television and king size bed. The many energy conservation measures incorporated into the construction of the hotel were apparent and most appreciated including all power on/off with your room key, low-flush toilet, flourescent light bulbs, etc. The room price included breakfast and the staff was very accommodating to meet special diet requirements. My only regret regarding food is that I did not have an opportunity to eat dinner in the restaurant. The menu appears wonderful. This is where I will stay whenever I am in San Francisco. It is my new favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Orchard Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelers86
Reviews.Content: We visited the Orchard Garden Hotel October 5th, 6th and 7th on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday. We found this "green" hotel on the internet and decided to give it a try. It exceeded our expectations. Upon entering the hotel, we found the decor beautiful and the fountain calming after a hectic day of travel. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient and it took only a few minutes to get us checked in and up to our room. There was no typical hotel smell. The lobby and our room smelled fresh and clean and looked it. The bed was one of the best parts of our visit, so comfortable and sheets that felt soft and looked like new. The buffet breakfast at the Roots Restaurant inside the hotel was excellent and got us on our way each day happy and full and ready for a great day of site seeing. The location of this hotel was perfect. The Entrance Gate to Chinatown was just a few steps away, and it was an easy walk to The Ferry Building to catch the wonderful weekend market. Also, the hotel is not far from public transportation. After a busy day, we enjoyed our drinks at the bar at Roots and long talks with the bartender. All of the staff was great and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: BurkeGustav
Reviews.Content: We started of our 15 night road trip honeymoon with 5 nights in the Orchard Garden. I had booked the room before the hotel opened and got a good rate. The room was spotless, lovely king size bed and a great view out onto the street. The bathroom was quite spacious, but we weren't so keen on the sliding door. I agree with the posters on the annoyance that there is no room to put your own water into the fridge provided. Breakfast was included and as other have said there was a good selection. Staff were friendly, but not overly. Location wise it's perfect. A few minutes up the road there is the cable car stop and down the hill Union Square. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PandB65
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, located right next to the China Gate entrance to Chinatown. It is within easy walking distance of Union Square and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants close by. The rooms are stylishly decorated and even though our room was only one floor up and facing the street, it was pretty quiet. Nice toiletries and bathrobes are supplied. The continental breakfast provided an excellent selection of fruit, pastries, bread & cheese and cereals. The front desk staff were very helpful. On-line booking worked fine, and a reminder e-mail was sent to us a few days before our stay which was reassuring. This hotel provided a very comfortable start to a three week road trip around California. We would not hesitate to recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Garden is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeca13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited San Francisco this week. Based on Trip Advisor's user recommendations we chose The Orchard Garden Hotel and we had a great experience! The staff is very helpful, the room, if is not a big one, has a lot of options that we usually do not find in other hotels e.g. plasma TV and Ipod docking amplifier. The room was super clean and prepaid with breakfast included. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location-Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suite01
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, and in an ideal location from shopping and the business district, especially if your in town for business. I loved the fact that it was next door to China Town, which I love to visit the stores and eat. Very close to the major shopping areas and the trolley cars. The room was a bit smaller than expected, especially based on the pictures shown on the site. For one person, it was ideal, but if my husband had come along, it would have felt a bit cramped. I did not like the fact that the frig was prestocked to the point you could not put your own drinks or left over food in there. If any of the items in the frig were moved, you automatically got charged for them whether you consumed them or not. I would have preferred everything been taken our completely and left with a usable frig. Need to make the note about moving the items off the dot for more than 20 seconds automatically charges your room for the goods, even if you just knock it over. Luckily I was told by a maintenance guy before I had an accident with the goods. Otherwise, very clean, comfortable bed, nice bath and tv channel options. Just need to add a hot tub for use on the balcony or roof for end of day, after all the walking you have to do. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fly121
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel, it is located near Union Square with great access to all the shopping nearby. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were nice and clean. We had an interior room with not much a view but we were not in the room for long. The price we paid was expensive I thought, over $800 for 2 nights. 'm not sure if something was going on in the city or if that is the regular rate for rooms here. We also had a walk-thru door to the next room and the sound proffing was not very good. I would probably stay here again but check for better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: frstbrn
Reviews.Content: I called the Orchard about a week before our visit on a last ditch effort to get a room here due to the positive reviews I saw on Trip Advisor ( I had booked somewhere else). I was lucky to find an open room and although the front desk could not lower the price (all hotels were booked and they were at full capacity) she did include breakfast in our stay which helped. Everyone was great. Although they do not have an official concierge desk like the big hotels each person went out of their way to help us find what we were looking for. each person gave us very personal service and always at 110%. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. My brother is a big environmentalist and I have already recommended it to him but I will recommend it to everyone going to San Francisco. I honestly cannot think of a bad thing to say about the Orchard Garden. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Membermaine07
Reviews.Content: I found the Orchard Garden an excellent boutique hotel in San Francisco. The only reason why it doesn't get a 5.0 rating is the ambience, which I found a little sterile. It is a LEED-certified hotel, which means it follows environmentally-friendly practices in its energy management and overall business practices. If this is important to you you should stay here. You will not be disappointed by the quality of the experience. The rooftop garden is very nice although I wish it had a bar. You can bring your own up there and we did and enjoyed it. I'm surprised more people weren't up there. The location is excellent, northeast of Union Square makes it even more walkable to North Beach and the waterfront as well as Chinatown (next door). The room was very clean, excellent and very comfortable bed. Didn't eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on it. Breakfast was included in the rate and was good if not spectacular. The modern decor and light colored woods I thought were just a little sterile looking. That's my only complaint. I'd certainly recommend it, however.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: washpa
Reviews.Content: I was traveling solo and had a wonderful experience at the Orchard Garden. As others have stated, the property is new, very clean, and has a calm and serene atmosphere. The roof garden is wonderful on a clear day and the overall emphasis on the environment throughout the hotel is very inspiring. The location is perfect - you can walk to Union Square, the Ferry Market and other key locations - and the trolley/cable cars and the Muni are very close to the hotel so transportation options are plentiful. My hotel rate did not include the complementary breakfast and so I had an excellent breakfast each morning across the street at a nice French cafe - less money than I would have paid at the OGH. As far as I am concerned, there are not enough properties like this anymore in the heart of our great urban areas. The OGH is a gem! Try it when you go to SF! PS - I requested car service to SFO on my last morning. The driver was on time and the rate was exactly what I was quoted the day before.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed vibe”
Reviews.Author: ldbparis
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel with lots of charm. Very clean and modern and efficient. I love the fact that it's LEED certified. The staff was very courteous although i was surprised no one helped get my bags up to the room. The contintental breakfast was also right on point. I got a great rate for this room as I was in town for a conference but I'm not sure I would pay the posted rate of $339 a night. The room was a little small - perfect for one person but 2 people would make it much more tight. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: orange24
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel. It's a great boutique hotel, very clean and reasonably priced. Service was friendly and helpful. The location couldn't be any better - close to Union Square, Chinatown, and restaurants. We would definitely stay at this hotel next time we're in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ashbay04
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Orchard Garden Hotel was just heaven after a 13 hour flight from Sydney. Check-in was an ease and we were in our room within 10 minutes from arriving. The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. I must say the best thing about the room was the bed, they are just amazing (best sleep for ages). We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and found the location to be very central, within walking distance to Union Square and close to the cable cars. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: geolon
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by a three night stay here. Very high standards were combined with unfussy and quietly competent service at the front desk. The Orchard Garden is in an excellent location for shops, restaurants and exploring the city. The complementary breakfast was the best quality we had experienced in a US hotel, and the beds appeared to have a magical ability to cure two hardened insomniacs.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we didn't have to leave the Orchard Garden Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GreatholsBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited the Orchard Garden Hotel for 8 nights and thorougly enjoyed the experience. The Double, double room with a view was lovely and a good size, as was the bathroom. Location superb for shopping and walking around. The friendliness and helpfullness of all the staff was a great plus, and we enjoyed sampling the house cocktails! Room service was excellent as was the meal in the restaurant. Altogether, our stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: manxgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights as part of our annual vacation from the UK. Excellent service and quality of furnishings. Noticed it's listed in Conde Nast 'hot list' for 2007. Location was fantastic, only a couple of blocks from Union square. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: NK02
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in this hotel, and it exceeded all our expectations - most importantly, its location is superb. In a city with many hills, we were pleased to find that most of SF's attractions are close by, and for the visits to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf, transport links were close to the hotel. The hotel itself was fantastic - very new feeling to the place, all furniture and fittings were spotless. Breakfast was more than adequate, and there is computer access in the 'Business Center'. Door staff were very helpful. Modestly priced for accomodation in an expensive city - if we are lucky enough to return to San Fran, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible window view, donâ€™t always trust these reviews”
Reviews.Author: Eudardo
Reviews.Content: My stay on the Orchard Garden was disappointing. We were visiting San Francisco on our 20th anniversary, had done all my homework and picked the Orchard Garden basically because of the Trip Advisors reviews. I was given room 305, and when we entered the room we saw this horrible brick wall facing our only window. You can take a look at it in photo attached. To see the room was a big disappointment, and would of never imagined from a Hotel of this category and cost. Exaggerating a bit, we couldnâ€™t tell night from day. We booked a Value Pack, where you pay 2 nights and receive the 3rd night at 50 % off. If this was the reason for the brick wall, I would have paid happily the 3 nights at full price. I mentioned this to the front desk (Jim I think) and he said that the Hotel was full and maybe the next day he could change us. Nothing happened. The breakfast was pretty lousy. Neither hot food nor scrambled egg, which is a must for me. This might seem silly but they have very small plates, and the bread simply doesnÂ´t fit in them. You could see in the other tables the bread just lying in the table, which is not very hygienic. The mini bar had a system that warned you that if something was taken out for more than 20 seconds, it would charge you. Also if you put some of your own beverage it would also charge you. I found this somewhat aggressive and not customer friendly. It doesnâ€™t seem a crime to put the soda you brought from outside to cool a bit in the mini-bar, especially considering the price they charge you in the mini-bar. It just didnâ€™t fit this ecological thing they have with these rigid rules. The hotel is clean, new and the rooms are modern and nice. The location is very good and valet parking worked well. Nevertheless, the brick wall simply ruined my anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wjh1953
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days at the Orchard Garden and loved it. the room was great with a comfortable bed, beautiful and functional bathroom and nice amenities including a big screen TV. The breakfast buffet was substantial and varied. We ate dinner in the restaurant "Roots" one night and the food was fabulous and, for San Francisco, reasonable. The location was great for us -- right next to Chinatown and close to the public transportation hub of Market Street. We stayed in three other hotels on this trip in other parts of northern California and agree that the OG was the best. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dory92064
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the Orchard Garden Hotel. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Excellent location in the city. Did not eat in the restaurant, but did enjoy a glass of wine and some cheese in the comfortable bar area. Nice breakfast with a good selection of items. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GoBrewers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden for 4 nights (August 23-26). The staff - from the front desk clerk to the bellman to the restaurant workers - was friendly to a fault! We felt very welcome from the minute we arrived. We had a 8th floor view room with two double beds. The room was immaculate....the beds were insanely comfortable....the sheets were perfect.....flat screen TV...AC worked well...the room was incredibly quiet even though it looked out on Bush Street and was a half-block from the main gate of Chinatown. Your room key-card activates the room's electricity when you enter the room and place it into the power "receptacle". A fantastic way to cut down on the amount of electricity the hotel uses! The European buffet breakfast each day was excellent. Fresh baked croissants, fresh fruits, yogurt, cereals, juices, coffee....it was an excellent start each morning! The hotel is conveniently located to Chinatown, Union Square. We actually walked to AT&T Park as well as North Beach from the hotel (about a mile in either direction). However, there is alot of mass transit available close by. There is a rooftop terrace which is an excellent place to read and catch the afternoon sun. I whole-heartedly recommend it! Overall, I'd say this hotel stay was one of the best I have had! The hotel has earned a LEED "green" rating which makes all of the luxuriuos surriundings seem even more luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Incredibly Friendly Staff - Loved The Orchard Garden Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lizzieann31
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel!! This was my first trip to San Francisco and they made my stay so much easier. They arranged transportation, gave easy to understand directions and one of the entrances to Chinatown was right next door. Plus, it is located in the financial district so there are lots of good places to eat and didn't have that cheesy tourist feel that some of the Wharf hotels might have (this, coming from a tourist - ha!) Also, the rooms were absolutely gorgeous, with a flat screen TV, thick duvets, everything shiny and new!! And the staff was so nice and helpful. I told my boyfriend that if we ever come to San Francisco together we are definitely staying here!! Plus, if you happen to take the double-decker bus hop on/hop off tours, they will let you off directly in front of the hotel, which was really convenient. All in all, an excellent hotel and accomodating staff - highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNonstop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 408 and it was great. Everything was SO CLEAN and SO NEW and SO WELL DONE! I loved te sliding bathroom door and the beds were very comfy and so were the pillows and bedding. I'm turning "GREEN" so knowing I was helping give back was also a HUGE plus! I'd stay there everytime! Do beware that a soda at the bar will cost you $3.56 before tip! A bit pricey for a can of Sprite. Very convienent to everything. The Cafe across the street, Cade De le Presse is delicous! Order the french toast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunNV
Reviews.Content: Our family thoroughly enjoyed a 6 day stay at the Orchard Garden. We arrived early in the morning and it was no problem to store our luggage for the day while we set off to explore the city. The check-in/check-out were smooth, the room was small but functional and tastefully decorated. The "green policy" appealed enormously to our family - especially our teenage daughters. The breakfast was terrific - the atmosphere was friendly, overall it was a very positive experience and we feel we got great value for our dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mandy9939
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Garden Hotel is new and spotless!!!. The staff made us feel extremely welcome and we really appreciate this "green" hotel's efforts in recycling and protecting the environment. We were encouraged to take our cocktails and snacks up to the outdoor terrace where there was plenty of tables/chairs and a nice view. Our stay came with a complimentary breakfast which had something for everyone and was delicious. Just a couple of blocks away from Union Square, the location is very convenient to shopping, Chinatown, dining, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeahB444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel for three nights during our California vacation and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is located just outside the gates to Chinatown and we were able to walk to the Embarcadero, Pier 39, Coit tower, Golden Gate state park, etc. The rooms are a little smaller than other hotel rooms we've stayed in however the bathroom was quite spacious. I am very particular about cleanliness and this hotel was clean, new, and well run. Comfortable beds and pillows, free movie rentals! The only thing missing would be a nice hot tub on the roof! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kitka2001
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orchard Garden for a girls weekend for two best friends and our 8 - 10 year old daughters. The location was great for that kind of trip. Two doors down from the gate to Chinatown meant a lot of great kid-friendly meals and shops. Quick walk to Union Square and transportation to the rest of the city. We booked two double rooms but were not told until arrival that each floor only has two double rooms - so one of us switched to a King room. This was fine with us but you should know this if expecting to be near traveling companions with the same room type booked. We did not get the City view and instead overlooked a courtyard and it was wonderfully quiet. I would definitely book standard again. The concierge at the Orchard Garden was great as was the night staff, who helped with everything with a smile. From hailing us the perfect taxi to recommending two very good restaurants, to getting us to the airport in time, the staff helped make the trip easier. The rooms were very clean and well stocked. The only thing I'd say was a negative was the mini-bar and snack trays which we nor the girls touched but seem to have been sensitive enough that we were charged for a water anyway. Not worth getting upset over but something to look out for. We did not try the restaurant as it was a bit pricey and there are so many affordable options within walking distance of the hotel. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLakeMary_Fl
Reviews.Content: We had just finished a stay at the Orchard Garden Hotel after a week of travel throughout California. Of all the places we stayed during our trip, the Orchard Garden was by far our favorite. The hotel as well as the room was extremely nice and we thought the amenities/bed in the room (the fact that it is a "Green" hotel was a definite plus) as well as the size of the room itself was perfect and comfortable for my wife and daughter. The hotel and lobby were very clean and the breakfast was great - scones, meat and cheese, etc. The location in the city next to Chinatown makes visiting that particular area of the city very easy and convenient. But the most overlooked part was simply the staff - from the valet to the desk person - they were extremely friendly and very accommodating. We had traveled to San Francisco from Malibu the day we checked in ... the staff made our transition into the room flawless, gave us directions and tips, all with a wonderful attitude throughout our entire stay. This was true even though when we checked in, we had about 15 minutes to get to a Giants game. This was a great experience and I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust74
Reviews.Content: The room: The Orchard Garden Hotel is a boutique hotel, so the rooms are tiny. However, the rooms are very clean and utilize the small space. The bed is amazing and the flat screen tv with a DVD player is a nice bonus. The only thing that I did not like about the room was the bathroom door, or lack there of. The "door" is actually a sliding panel that does not completely shut all the way. The breakfast: Free breakfast is included each morning. The breakfast choices include huge croissants, delicious scones and muffins, fruit, bagels, cold ham cuts, cheese, hard boiled eggs, cereals, juice, and coffee. The scones, croissants, and muffins were all quality and similar to those you would find at a nice pastry shop. The location: What a great location! You are right next to the Grant Avenue entrance to China Town. You are a few blocks from shopping at Union Square. You are approximately 3/4 a mile from Coit Tower and approximately 1 mile from the Embarcadero. We walked to dinner each night and found great restaurants in China Town, Little Italy, and North Beach. There were plenty of Muni bus stops in walking distance and the BART and Muni underground were four blocks away. We called "511", which is free if you call from the bay area, which allows you to speak with someone who will tell you what bus route to take to certain places and where the bus picks you up. We easily took the bus to the Golden Gate Park, the Presidio, the Golden Gate Bridge, and AT&T Park. You are in walking distance to many restaurants, coffee shops, and retail stores. However, many of the restaurants close by 10:00 pm. If you are a late night diner, then try Chinatown. Overall: I will definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to my friends and family. For $179 a night, the hotel is a deal. The location is perfect for those who want to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: jrx522
Reviews.Content: Great Location...Brand New Hotel @ $179 per night for Fri/Sat stay....Friendly Staff.....Flat screen TV.....Had a fantastic stay and look forward to returning in the future....Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: RobynRAZ
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking the city. Wonderful beds and a environmentally conscience hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Orchard Garden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 466 Bush Street, San Francisco, CA 94108
